commit_message:
Adding a basic testing example

In addition to writing secure, we should be encouraging testcases
to find insecure code. I've added this to provide some basic examples
of how you might test a section of code to make sure file creation
is done using secure permissions.

Change-Id: I5c831f49b546be58f6ec1a228e435a0372f3fcf0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/47/293147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Testing guide ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ It should be possible to test anything that performs file creation to make sure that permissions are being set correctly. The following example inspects that the file is created with expected permissions and that an exception is raised if the file already exists. .. code:: python import stat import os import unittest def do_something(path, mode): flags = os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT | os.O_EXCL return os.fdopen(os.open(path, flags, 0600), mode) class TestFileCreation(unittest.TestCase): def test_correct_permissions(self): """ Make sure that a file can be created with specific permissions """ test_file = "demo.txt" with do_something(test_file, "w") as fout: fout.write("blah blah blah") finfo = os.stat(test_file) assert(finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IRUSR) assert(finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IWUSR) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IXUSR) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IRGRP) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IWGRP) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IXGRP) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IROTH) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IWOTH) assert(not finfo.st_mode & stat.S_IXOTH) os.remove(test_file) def test_file_exists(self): """ If the file already exists an OSError should be raised. """ test_file = "demo2.txt" # simulate file already placed at location by attacker with open(test_file, "w") as fout: fout.write("nasty attacker stuff") # ensure that we can't open the file with self.assertRaises(OSError): with do_something(test_file, "w") as fout: fout.write("this should never happen..") os.remove(test_file) You can also use mock to ensure that any calls to os.open are made with restrictive permissions. .. code:: python import os import mock import unittest def do_something(dummy_file): flags = os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT | os.O_EXCL with os.fdopen(os.open(dummy_file, flags, 0600), "w") as fout: fout.write("blah blah") print("doing something") class TestUsingMock(unittest.TestCase): def test_do_something(self): """ Make sure that any file created is done with sufficiently secure permissions. """ with mock.patch('os.open') as os_open, mock.patch('os.fdopen') as os_fdopen: # setup test call dummy_file = "dummy.txt" os_open.return_value = 123 do_something(dummy_file) # ensure the file is being created with specific flags # and permission set flags = os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT | os.O_EXCL os_open.assert_called_with(dummy_file, flags, 0600) os_fdopen.assert_called_with(123, "w")

subject: Ensure log messages are not translation objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-15 16:35:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/2d8af9f6f7a01543403752f339b0ca46fb33d959', 'message': "Ensure log messages are not translation objects

Often logs use the same messages that were to go up to the
browser for the user, this meant they had to be localised, however we
don't want the string representation of a translation object or a
localised string being printed into the logs. This patch either removes
the localisation from messages being written to the logs where possible
or in the case a message is used for both logs and being shown to the
user, forces the log message into a unicode english string.
** This patch should not affect the messages seen in the browser, only
messages in the logs **

Change-Id: I315f378f63f6ae718373f5b123d6738e1edf2386
Closes-Bug: 1406333
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-16 17:37:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8c3a38bfb9c896872f612d30dc069dd80716646c', 'message': "Ensure log messages are not translation objects

commit_message:
Ensure log messages are not translation objects

Often logs use the same messages that were to go up to the
browser for the user, this meant they had to be localised, however we
don't want the string representation of a translation object or a
localised string being printed into the logs. This patch either removes
the localisation from messages being written to the logs where possible
or in the case a message is used for both logs and being shown to the
user, forces the log message into a unicode english string.
** This patch should not affect the messages seen in the browser, only
messages in the logs **

Change-Id: I315f378f63f6ae718373f5b123d6738e1edf2386
Closes-Bug: 1406333

Cluster is not locked after deployment

Remove test to unlock patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297168/

After it's merged, fixed test will be returned back.

Change-Id: I78695ff11f8980e44e7ed41f5407c118f61e5608
Implements: blueprint unlock-settings-tab

commit_message:
Fix truncate table size column cause the exception

To reproduce:
1.edit openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tables.py
2.add 'truncate=40' to image size column
3.open the image page give the error

TypeError: object of type 'int' has no len()
Internal Server Error: /project/images/

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I1d32899b54d61dc7550377a69435b1c0dfc0b660
Closes-Bug: #1504397
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/232910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if column.filters: for filter_func in column.filters: try: data = filter_func(data) except Exception: msg = ("Filter '%(filter)s' failed with data " "'%(data)s' on column '%(col_name)s'") args = {'filter': filter_func.__name__, 'data': data, 'col_name': six.text_type(self.verbose_name)} LOG.warning(msg, args)

subject: Fix order-of-operations bug in os-net-config restart_interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:42:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/36b1ad6c4f988dd5a299353651a1fec6a0650d36', 'message': 'Fix order-of-operations bug in os-net-config restart_interfaces

The current order of operations of bringing up interfaces starts
with the bridges, and restarts the members of the bridges. This
works well when an OVS bond is part of an OVS bridge, but does not
work well when Linux bonding is used with no bridges (such as in
the case of the Nuage plugin, which creates the bridges outside of
the ifcfg files).

This change will ensure that Linux bonds are brought up first, then
any bridges are brought up, interfaces are brought up next, and the
VLAN interfacs are brought up last. This corrects a race condition
where any VLAN which was brought up before the bond would not be
active, and the VLAN would have to be brought up by hand.

This change also fixes a logging issue where os-net-config would
report that no changes were necessary when changes were made. Now,
the logging messages indicating that "No changes were necessary"
show up when no changes are required, instead of when changes are
actually made.

Change-Id: I1efee3dfd8e8cef01b054bb57a3085cc7eb60372

This change will ensure that Linux bonds are brought up first, then

commit_message:
Fix order-of-operations bug in os-net-config restart_interfaces

The current order of operations of bringing up interfaces starts
with the bridges, and restarts the members of the bridges. This
works well when an OVS bond is part of an OVS bridge, but does not
work well when Linux bonding is used with no bridges (such as in
the case of the Nuage plugin, which creates the bridges outside of
the ifcfg files).

This change will ensure that Linux bonds are brought up first, then
any bridges are brought up, interfaces are brought up next, and the
VLAN interfacs are brought up last. This corrects a race condition
where any VLAN which was brought up before the bond would not be
active, and the VLAN would have to be brought up by hand.

This change also fixes a logging issue where os-net-config would
report that no changes were necessary when changes were made. Now,
the logging messages indicating that "No changes were necessary"
show up when no changes are required, instead of when changes are
actually made.

Change-Id: I1efee3dfd8e8cef01b054bb57a3085cc7eb60372

commit_message:
Cleanup orphaned code from brick LVM

There were several methods in the brick lvm code that were no longer
being used anywhere. While some of these have potential for being useful,
they are not in use and should not be sitting around the codebase waiting
for someone to need them.

This patch removes unused methods as well as their associated unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib3aba7b6b51a525855c5357e4164478f26e9ee98

commit_message:
[microversions] Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25

Microversion 2.25 changed an interface for `live_migrate` server action. It
doesn't support disk-over-commit option anymore. We should remove this
parameter from host-evacuate-live action too.

Change-Id: I088eebd1c895feb5eeac35475ddcd2b276b7b158
Closes-Bug: #1561938

commit_message:
Custom graph run support added to handlers

These handlers now support query string param `graph_type` that defining
what graph to use during command execution:

/clusters/<cluster_id>/deploy/
/clusters/<cluster_id>/deploy_tasks/
/clusters/<cluster_id>/deploy_tasks/graph.gv

Change-Id: I893b5bed041a02197fcc4af5682766b1d64b02ed
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

commit_message:
Tasks and graph info handlers updated for custom DeploymentGraph

Existing `GET /releases/<release_id>/deployment_tasks/`
extended with `graph_type` parameter for the consistency with
cluster `/deployment_tasks` handler

Existing `GET /clusters/<cluster_id>/serialized_tasks/`
extended with `graph_type` parameter.

Existing `GET /clusters/<cluster_id>/deploy_tasks/graph.gv`
extended with `graph_type` parameter.

Change-Id: Idd44782340d468cfcba09f013aa0d054dc9ebfd7
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

commit_message:
Append BRANCH_PATH to filenames of build output

This adds $BRANCH_PATH (from the dependent patch) to the file names of
the build output, so that we can upload images for each branch we
maintain.

Change-Id: I8c767fa1b56a566c1acabab8552a51ffeb4e1d7d
Depends-On: I540d2f139c80bb7f382315258dbe3a7a14be74c8
Partial-Bug: #1561756

subject: Make flavor extra_specs operations work against the API DB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 16:47:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2b5320ecba10ac18c3766da4982e417dcb469d74', 'message': "Make flavor extra_specs operations work against the API DB

We already had loading extra_specs working from the API DB,
thanks to the SQLA relationship. This makes saving them work
against it as well.

This adds a test_save_api() copy of the test_save method with the
appropriate changes, which also increases coverage over the access
changes from a previous patch now that we can run the whole save()
method against API. Later we'll just delete the old test method
when we drop compatibility for saving to the old database.

Further coverage for this will be increased in a later patch,
when we gain the ability to create flavors in the API DB natively,
which will let us try to run more functional tests against flavors
in both databases the way we'd expect in production.

Change-Id: I63706bde5eaaa9af3b864307b446ed0cf30d8a1b

commit_message:
Make flavor extra_specs operations work against the API DB

We already had loading extra_specs working from the API DB, thanks
to the SQLA relationship. This makes saving them work against it
as well.

This adds a test_save_api() copy of the test_save method with the
appropriate changes, which also increases coverage over the access
changes from a previous patch now that we can run the whole save()
method against API. Later we'll just delete the old test method
when we drop compatibility for saving to the old database.

Further coverage for this will be increased in a later patch,
when we gain the ability to create flavors in the API DB natively,
which will let us try to run more functional tests against flavors
in both databases the way we'd expect in production.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: I63706bde5eaaa9af3b864307b446ed0cf30d8a1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/294710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.objects.Flavor._flavor_add_project') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Flavor._flavor_del_project') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Flavor._flavor_extra_specs_del') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Flavor._flavor_extra_specs_add') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Flavor.in_api', new=True) def test_save_api(self, mock_update, mock_delete, mock_remove, mock_add): ctxt = self.context.elevated() extra_specs = {'key1': 'value1', 'key2': 'value2'} projects = ['project-1', 'project-2'] flavor = flavor_obj.Flavor(context=ctxt, flavorid='foo', id=123, extra_specs=extra_specs, projects=projects) flavor.obj_reset_changes() # Test deleting an extra_specs key and project del flavor.extra_specs['key1'] del flavor.projects[-1] self.assertEqual(set(['extra_specs', 'projects']), flavor.obj_what_changed()) flavor.save() self.assertEqual({'key2': 'value2'}, flavor.extra_specs) mock_delete.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'foo', 'key1') self.assertEqual(['project-1'], flavor.projects) mock_remove.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 123, 'project-2') # Test updating an extra_specs key value flavor.extra_specs['key2'] = 'foobar' self.assertEqual(set(['extra_specs']), flavor.obj_what_changed()) flavor.save() self.assertEqual({'key2': 'foobar'}, flavor.extra_specs) mock_update.assert_called_with(ctxt, 'foo', {'key2': 'foobar'}) # Test adding an extra_specs and project flavor.extra_specs['key3'] = 'value3' flavor.projects.append('project-3') self.assertEqual(set(['extra_specs', 'projects']), flavor.obj_what_changed()) flavor.save() self.assertEqual({'key2': 'foobar', 'key3': 'value3'}, flavor.extra_specs) mock_update.assert_called_with(ctxt, 'foo', {'key2': 'foobar', 'key3': 'value3'}) self.assertEqual(['project-1', 'project-3'], flavor.projects) mock_add.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 123, 'project-3') def test_extra_specs_in_db(self): db_flavor = self._create_api_flavor(self.context) flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id(self.context, db_flavor['id']) flavor.extra_specs['marty'] = 'mcfly' del flavor.extra_specs['foo'] flavor.save() flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id(self.context, db_flavor['id']) self.assertEqual({'marty': 'mcfly'}, flavor.extra_specs)

added_lines: def start_server(self, srv, timeout): self.nova.servers.start(srv) try: helpers.wait( lambda: self.get_instance_detail(srv).status == "ACTIVE", timeout=timeout) return self.get_instance_detail(srv.id) except TimeoutError: logger.debug("Start server failed by timeout") asserts.assert_equal( self.get_instance_detail(srv).status, "ACTIVE", "Instance did not reach active state, current state" " is {0}".format(self.get_instance_detail(srv).status))

In case of failed volume migration, status of the volume is
still in-use and the migration status is set to error.

Current reset migration-status API resets not only
migration status but also volume status. However the volume

commit_message:
Does not reset volume status when resetting migration status

In case of failed volume migration, status of the volume is
still in-use and the migration status is set to error.

Current reset migration-status API resets not only
migration status but also volume status. However the volume
status should not reset because the volume is still attached.

Closes-Bug #1552058
Change-Id: If600f2163258946a2c87c45ff7a30eddd040ea2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/98/288598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_reset_migration_status_inuse(self): # Test for stucking in-use volume during volume migration. # The in-use status should be remained. volume = self._create_volume(self.ctx, {'status': 'in-use', 'migration_status': 'migrating', 'attach_status': 'attached'}) resp = self._issue_volume_reset(self.ctx, volume, {'migration_status': 'none'}) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status_int) volume = db.volume_get(self.ctx, volume['id']) self.assertIsNone(volume['migration_status']) self.assertEqual('in-use', volume['status']) self.assertEqual('attached', volume['attach_status'])

commit_message:
Move config options from nova/network/manager.py

This patch moves the config options from the nova/network/manager.py
file into the nova/conf/network.py file.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I7a00e6516762ae3794a14358d609be6e174926eb

commit_message:
Revert "Functional test for address scope"

This functional test seems to be failing intermittently.  We need to
figure out what's going on.  I'll post this and then we can get
logstash queries and stuff and take a look.

This reverts commit efe8b548bc4e64049df673d36838f29a7431046d.

Change-Id: Iba8e70a4c1b50a3a169d8b293d836668e0bb3fd4

commit_message:
[microversion] Bump to 2.25

microversion v2.25 will change parameter of os-migrateLive, this patch
adds supports to that changes.

os-migrateLive will abandon disk_over_commit and the default value of
block_migration will be set to `auto`

Depends-on: Ibb0d50f0f7444028ef9d0c294aea41edf0024b31
Implements: blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly
Change-Id: I01b22593724616bc0a7793c509ecabf095d6927d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/83/260383/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: block_migration=None, return self.manager.live_migrate(self, host, block_migration, disk_over_commit) @api_versions.wraps('2.0', '2.14') if block_migration is None: block_migration = False @api_versions.wraps('2.15') def live_migrate(self, server, host, block_migration, disk_over_commit): """ Migrates a running instance to a new machine. :param server: instance id which comes from nova list. :param host: destination host name. :param block_migration: if True, do block_migration. :param disk_over_commit: if True, Allow overcommit. """ body = {} if host is not None: body.update({'host': host}) if block_migration is not None: body.update({'block_migration': block_migration}) return self._action('os-migrateLive', server, body)

commit_message:
Fix path to rhel registration environment

The rhel registration environment was moved to pre_deploy extraconfig
from post_config, but this path was never updated in tripleoclient. This
patch updates the path to the current location.

Change-Id: If5c0bab880ed4f6b0ee308ed73992aaa1c767081
(cherry picked from commit 5ad4ca3cdbc92559b54695e2d64159dc2a02fc7f)

commit_message:
InfluxDB: drop support

The driver has been broken for a while, and there's no interest shown in
fixing it. No known user of Gnocchi rely on it.

Since there's little interest in using InfluxDB behind Gnocchi, let's
drop that code altogether.

Change-Id: I25d30a35e218ac3c6c531e3a943b1d2023978110

commit_message:
Skip distribution for 1G hugepages

Since Fuel uses kernel 3.13 is't impossible
to configure 1G hugepages in runtime. Hence
nailgun shouldn't send information about
distribution of hugepages to astute.yaml.
Thus kernel will distribute hugepages
by himself. It can be enabled as soon as
kernel 3.16 will be used.

Change-Id: I77007df8713854f7c806c4de715c435648184079
Closes-Bug: #1560532

subject: Reduce number of OVSDB row changes during ACL updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-19 18:53:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/ee59824c6170513d562ac66970d0b485d9ffa925', 'message': 'Reduce number of OVSDB ACL transactions

This patch set adds reduces the number of ACL transactions add to the
OVS DB transaction list. The patch compares the existing ACLs
associated with a port with the new set of ACLs. Only the delta
between the sets of ACLs are submitted to the OVS transaction list.

Change-Id: Ib968583685128ba44c91c30bcd522595645273da
Closes-bug: #1545189
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-22 07:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/e427f6d880102145f82647d1a5dc08481c2ffaf7', 'message': 'Reduce number of OVSDB ACL transactions

This patch set adds reduces the number of ACL transactions add to the
OVS DB transaction list. The patch compares the existing ACLs
associated with a port with the new set of ACLs. Only the difference
between the sets of ACLs are submitted to the OVS transaction list.

Improvement Seen:
-----------------

Consider a scenario where ports are attached to a network (provider
or private), and each port is assigned an unique IP Address i.e. a
common scenario, and is attached to the default security group.
Without the patch, a sample setup was seeing OVSDB transaction
timeouts when the 101th port was added to the network. This is
because the existing code deleted all (7) acls existing 100 ports and
re-added 6 acls back and modified 1 acl to include the 101th ports
ip address. This aslo resulted in (7+7)*100=1400 row changes in the
OVN_Northbound DB, and consequently 1400 notification of changes need
to be processed by processes monitoring changes in OVN_Northbound DB.

With the patch for the above case only (1 add +1 delete)*100 = 200
rows are modified and 200 row change notification sent to the
clients.

Result:
Existing Code: OVSDB transaction timeout seen in 101st port addition.
With the patch: OVSDB transaction timeout seen in the 270th port
addition - this timeout was not related to the 270*2=540 ACL
transactions, but seems to related to other OVSDB activity.
Regardless there is an improvement of 2.7X in terms of the number of
ports allowed to be provisioned in a provider or private network.

Change-Id: Ib968583685128ba44c91c30bcd522595645273da
Closes-bug: #1545189

commit_message:
Reduce number of OVSDB row changes during ACL updates

This patch set reduces the number of ACL rows changed during the
ACL update algorithm. The patch compares the existing ACLs
associated with a port with the new set of ACLs. Only the difference
between the sets of ACLs are submitted to the OVS transaction list.

Improvement Seen:
-----------------

Consider a scenario where ports are attached to a network (provider
or private), and each port is assigned an unique IP Address i.e. a
common scenario, and is attached to the default security group.
Without the patch, a sample setup was seeing OVSDB transaction
timeouts when the 101th port was added to the network. This is
because the existing code deleted all (7) acls existing 100 ports and
re-added 6 acls back and modified 1 acl to include the 101th ports
ip address. This also resulted in (7+7)*100=1400 row changes in the
OVN_Northbound DB, and consequently 1400 notification of changes need
to be processed by processes monitoring changes in OVN_Northbound DB.

With the patch for the above case only (1 add +1 delete)*100 = 200
rows are modified and 200 row change notification sent to the
clients.

Result:
Existing Code: OVSDB transaction timeout seen in 101st port addition.
With the patch: OVSDB transaction timeout seen in the 270th port
addition - this timeout was not related to the 270*2=540 ACL
transactions, but seems to related to other OVSDB activity.
Regardless there is an improvement of 2.7X in terms of the number of
ports allowed to be provisioned in a provider or private network.

Change-Id: Ib968583685128ba44c91c30bcd522595645273da
Closes-bug: #1545189
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/88/282488/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: acls_new = self._add_acls(context, port, sg_ports_cache=sg_ports_cache, subnet_cache=subnet_cache) for acl in acls_new: txn.add(self._ovn.add_acl(**acl)) acl = {"lswitch": utils.ovn_name(port['network_id']), "lport": port['id'], "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW_RELATED, "log": False, "direction": dir_map[r['direction']], "match": match, "external_ids": {'neutron:lport': port['id']}} return acl def _add_acl_dhcp(self, context, port, subnet_cache): acl_list = [] acl = {"lswitch": utils.ovn_name(port['network_id']), "lport": port['id'], "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW, "log": False, "direction": 'to-lport', "match": ('outport == "%s" && ip4 && ip4.src == %s && ' 'udp && udp.src == 67 && udp.dst == 68' ) % (port['id'], subnet['cidr']), "external_ids": {'neutron:lport': port['id']}} acl_list.append(acl) acl = {"lswitch": utils.ovn_name(port['network_id']), "lport": port['id'], "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW, "log": False, "direction": 'from-lport', "match": ('inport == "%s" && ip4 && ' '(ip4.dst == 255.255.255.255 || ' 'ip4.dst == %s) && ' 'udp && udp.src == 68 && udp.dst == 67' ) % (port['id'], subnet['cidr']), "external_ids": {'neutron:lport': port['id']}} acl_list.append(acl) return acl_list def _drop_all_ip_traffic_for_port(self, port): acl_list = [] lswitch = utils.ovn_name(port['network_id']) lport = port['id'] acl = {"lswitch": lswitch, "lport": lport, "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_DROP, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_DROP, "log": False, "direction": direction, "match": '%s == "%s" && ip' % (p, port['id']), "external_ids": {'neutron:lport': port['id']}} acl_list.append(acl) return acl_list def _acls_cmp(self, acl1, acl2): if len(acl1) != len(acl2): return False for key, value in six.iteritems(acl1): if value != acl2[key]: return False return True def _acl_exists(self, acl_list, acl): for _acl in acl_list: if self._acls_cmp(_acl, acl): return True return False def _acl_list_sub(self, acl_list1, acl_list2): acl_diff = [] for acl in acl_list1: if not self._acl_exists(acl_list2, acl): acl_diff.append(acl) return acl_diff def _get_acls(self, context, lswitch_list): acl_dict = {} for lswitch_name in lswitch_list: try: lswitch = idlutils.row_by_value(self._ovn.idl, 'Logical_Switch', 'name', utils.ovn_name(lswitch_name)) except idlutils.RowNotFound: msg = _("Logical Switch %s does not exist") % lswitch_name raise RuntimeError(msg) acls = getattr(lswitch, 'acls', []) for acl in acls: # acl_keys = getattr(acl, "_data", {}).keys()[:] ext_ids = getattr(acl, 'external_ids', {}) port_id = ext_ids.get('neutron:lport') try: acl_list = acl_dict[port_id] except KeyError: acl_list = [] acl_dict[port_id] = acl_list acl_string = {'lport': port_id, 'lswitch': 'neutron-' + lswitch_name} for acl_key in six.iterkeys(getattr(acl, "_data", {})): try: acl_string[acl_key] = getattr(acl, acl_key) except KeyError: pass acl_list.append(acl_string) return acl_dict def _add_acls(self, context, port, sg_cache=None, sg_ports_cache=None, subnet_cache=None): acl_list = [] return acl_list acl_list += self._drop_all_ip_traffic_for_port(port) acl_list += self._add_acl_dhcp(context, port, commit_message:
Skip fullstack L3 HA test

It's failing because of a known issue, being handled in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285480/. That patch will
unskip the test as part of the fix.

Apart from this test, there's also a known failure in LB
tests, being handled here:
and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294798/

I'm not aware of any other failure modes for fullstack.
With these two patches merged, we can observe the fullstack
job failure rate and hopefully make it voting.

Change-Id: I6ea3292605d25848911a2d51c996d10ecd48bf9e
(cherry picked from commit d6fb0c46bdf238b2b21761e979198388a0446149)

commit_message:
Fix setting peer to bridge interfaces

OVSDB implementation refuses to set options:peer column value
 as there is no such column in the Interface table. The correct way
 is to set 'options' column value to a map containing key 'peer', as
 already used in ovs_lib.

Change-Id: Ib5e956f425b36f54cda017c91ac71d9d7ee9747c
Closes-Bug: 1528894

commit_message:
coordination: expose a heartbeat loop methods

This allows to delegate the heartbeat() loop entirely to Tooz. Tooz has
various information, such as the time required between heartbeats, that
the consumer application does not possess, which makes it hard to build
something reliable.

Change-Id: I35cd50aa7b7017e0a2309bed969e7e26e8b6f5a5
Closes-Bug: #1557593

commit_message:
Subnet: Add "subnet set" command using SDK

This patch adds "subnet set" command to osc using sdk.

Implements: blueprint neutron-client

Closes-bug: #1542363

Change-Id: Id3b7f4b9190b4d73ca3ae423321a65f94a6da62e

parsed_args.no_dhcp is True: body['enable_dhcp'] = False if parsed_args.dns_nameservers is not None: body['dns_nameservers'] = parsed_args.dns_nameservers if parsed_args.gateway is not None: body['gateway_ip'] = parsed_args.gateway if parsed_args.host_routes is not None: body['host_routes'] = parsed_args.host_routes class CreateSubnet(command.ShowOne): """Create a subnet""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreateSubnet, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'name', help='New subnet name' ) parser.add_argument( '--subnetpool', metavar='<subnetpool>', help='ID or name of subnetpool from which this subnet ' 'will obtain a CIDR' ) parser.add_argument( '--prefixlen', metavar='<prefixlen>', help='Prefix length for subnet allocation from subnetpool' ) parser.add_argument( '--cidr', metavar='<cidr>', help='CIDR of the subnet' ) parser.add_argument( _get_common_parse_arguments(parser) _get_common_body(body, parsed_args) class SetSubnet(command.Command): """Set subnet properties""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(SetSubnet, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'subnet', metavar="<subnet>", help=("Subnet to modify (name or ID)") ) _get_common_parse_arguments(parser) parser.add_argument( '--name', metavar='<name>', help='Update Subnet name', ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network body = {} if parsed_args.name: body['name'] = str(parsed_args.name) _get_common_body(body, parsed_args) if not body: msg = "Nothing specified to be set" raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) client.update_subnet(body, **body) return

subject: Achieved goal should be returned by each strategy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 08:01:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs/commit/ea60e1078c5d7f82bd261a24f73fe19ef3408f1d', 'message': 'Achieved goal should be returned by each strategy

Today, there is no way to know what goal is achieved by a given
strategy. The mapping between goal and strategies is done in the
Watcher configuration.

Beyond that, there is no way to know that several strategies achieve
the same optimization goal.

commit_message:
Achieved goal should be returned by each strategy

Today, there is no way to know what goal is achieved by a given
strategy. The mapping between goal and strategies is done in the
Watcher configuration.

Beyond that, there is no way to know that several strategies achieve
the same optimization goal.

There should be a way to return the list of available goals depending
on which strategies have been deployed on the node where the Watcher
Decision Engine is running.

Change-Id: I29e6b5cb8c9314b66a5b740ee2cd2f9097468a08
Implements: blueprint get-goal-from-strategy

commit_message:
Implements resource type CRUD.

This is the boiler plate for resource type CRUD.

Legacy Ceilometer rule are still loaded from entry point

The CRUD interface doesn't allow to add attributes yet

Blueprint resource-type-rest-api
Change-Id: I762e42b1b5f9ed78fdaef51bb601e97468b8cf61

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I702b3d0397d9c24594095bd98058ef34c0a15a1e

commit_message:
Prevent command injection

Shell=True parameter removed from subprocess call,
when schema diff is made, to avoid command injection vulnerability.

Change-Id: I7dce2d91a2fd85380d1eb2ac5e5013b6efde5509
Closes-Bug: #1450798
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/276751/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subprocess.check_call(cmd) % {'name': name, 'dump_filename': dump_filename}) % {'name': name, 'dump_filename': dump_filename})
deleted_lines: subprocess.check_call(cmd, shell=True) % {'name': name, 'dump_filename': dump_filename}, shell=True) % {'name': name, 'dump_filename': dump_filename}, shell=True)

revisions:

This will use the ceph monitor cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade

Change-Id: Id9f89241f3aebe4886310e9b208bcb19f88e1e3e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-06 04:27:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/2a7ba27d45a677aa8218f7a818ad18bc2efb37fd', 'message': 'Added functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to upgrade in a serial rolled fashion. '}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:22:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/4d58080de1efe63e8abdde579e62ea4b89c0eb44', 'message': 'Added functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade

Change-Id: Id9f89241f3aebe4886310e9b208bcb19f88e1e3e
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-11 16:48:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/b857dfd8f413f2ee9aa0abf595cb0a90f96fe977', 'message': "Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade.
The upgrade is initiated setting a config value for source for the
service which will prompt the osd cluster to upgrade to that new
source and restart all osds processes server by server.  If an osd
server has been waiting on a previous server for more than 10 minutes
and hasn't seen it finish it will assume it died during the upgrade
and proceed with its own upgrade.

Limtations of this patch: If the osd failure domain has been set to osd
than this patch will cause brief temporary outages while osd processes
are being restarted.  Future work will handle this case.

Change-Id: Id9f89241f3aebe4886310e9b208bcb19f88e1e3e
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-15 21:51:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/db5c3ae72df5cad4be0625ce4b43d2f934b32830', 'message': "Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade.
The upgrade is initiated setting a config value for source for the
service which will prompt the osd cluster to upgrade to that new
source and restart all osds processes server by server.  If an osd
server has been waiting on a previous server for more than 10 minutes
and hasn't seen it finish it will assume it died during the upgrade
and proceed with its own upgrade.

I had to modify the amulet test slightly to use the ceph-mon charm
instead of the default ceph charm.  I also changed the test so that
it uses 3 ceph-osd servers instead of 1.

Limtations of this patch: If the osd failure domain has been set to osd
than this patch will cause brief temporary outages while osd processes
are being restarted.  Future work will handle this case.

Change-Id: Id9f89241f3aebe4886310e9b208bcb19f88e1e3e
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-17 16:15:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/0457097538af4f2544e01efb0da6501cd0d4ff45', 'message': "Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

commit_message:
Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade.
The upgrade is initiated setting a config value for source for the
service which will prompt the osd cluster to upgrade to that new
source and restart all osds processes server by server.  If an osd
server has been waiting on a previous server for more than 10 minutes
and hasn't seen it finish it will assume it died during the upgrade
and proceed with its own upgrade.

I had to modify the amulet test slightly to use the ceph-mon charm
instead of the default ceph charm.  I also changed the test so that
it uses 3 ceph-osd servers instead of 1.

Limtations of this patch: If the osd failure domain has been set to osd
than this patch will cause brief temporary outages while osd processes
are being restarted.  Future work will handle this case.

Change-Id: Id9f89241f3aebe4886310e9b208bcb19f88e1e3e

If an instance is old we create request spec object in the old way.
Unfortunately the old way does not populate instance group and
therefore server group policies are not honored during live migration.
To fix this issue this patch repopulates instance group information
in request spec object.

Change-Id: Id7e669e0a6db1ff1052c42006f1a141bdb8cdf29

commit_message:
Try to repopulate instance_group if it is None

There are cases that we need to create new RequestSpect object and we
pass None for instance_group argument. It might cause server group
policies to be omitted during filtering phase. Therefore if
instance_group is None we should try to repopulate instance_group
basing on data that is in filter_properties.

Change-Id: Id7e669e0a6db1ff1052c42006f1a141bdb8cdf29
Closes-Bug: #1561022

commit_message:
Also package murano_tempest_tests

Currently, murano's setup.cfg has a unique package "murano". This
patch adds murano_tempest_tests, so that the tempest plugin also
ends up being packaged in Debian / Ubuntu. This way, it's possible
to also run Murano's functional test suite in the Debian CI.

Closes-Bug: #1561966
Change-Id: Ia2f73883aaeeef92956daabb53fd3289ff1fc744
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/45/297645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: murano_tempest_tests

This patch updates replication to match the v2.1 spec. This makes
it possible to replicate an entire backend, and upon failover, all
replicated volumes will be failed over together.

cinder.conf should have the replication config group:

The replication can be configured via either multi-backend on one
cinder volume node, or on separate cinder volume nodes.

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the primary back-end is
located:

enabled_backends = sv1, sv2 (if enabling multi-backends)

[sv1]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.11
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv1
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder
replication_device = managed_backend_name:second_host@sv2#sv2,
                     backend_id:svc_backend_id,
                     replication_mode:global,
                     san_ip:192.168.0.12,san_login:admin,
                     san_password:admin,pool_name:cinder_target

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the secondary back-end is
connected:

[sv2]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.12
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv2
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder_target

Closes-Bug: #1544611

Change-Id: I8a4963fa4b30f2df1903697909deece762228257

cinder.conf should have the replication config group:

The replication can be configured via either multi-backend on one
cinder volume node, or on separate cinder volume nodes.

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the primary back-end is
located:

enabled_backends = sv1, sv2 (if enabling multi-backends)

[sv1]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.11
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv1
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder
replication_device = managed_backend_name:second_host@sv2#sv2,
                     backend_id:svc_backend_id,
                     replication_mode:global,
                     san_ip:192.168.0.12,san_login:admin,
                     san_password:admin,pool_name:cinder_target

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the secondary back-end is
connected:

[sv2]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.12
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv2
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder_target

Closes-Bug: #1544611

commit_message:
Storwize: Update replication to v2.1

This patch updates replication to match the v2.1 spec. This makes
it possible to replicate an entire backend, and upon failover, all
replicated volumes will be failed over together.

cinder.conf should have the replication config group:

The replication can be configured via either multi-backend on one
cinder volume node, or on separate cinder volume nodes.

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the primary back-end is
located:

enabled_backends = sv1, sv2 (if enabling multi-backends)

[sv1]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.11
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv1
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder
replication_device = managed_backend_name:second_host@sv2#sv2,
                     backend_id:svc_backend_id,
                     replication_mode:global,
                     san_ip:192.168.0.12,san_login:admin,
                     san_password:admin,pool_name:cinder_target

Options to be put in cinder.conf, where the secondary back-end is
connected:

[sv2]
san_login = admin
san_password = admin
san_ip = 192.168.0.12
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.storwize_svc.\
                storwize_svc_iscsi.StorwizeSVCISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = sv2
storwize_svc_volpool_name=cinder_target

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1544611

Change-Id: I8a4963fa4b30f2df1903697909deece762228257

commit_message:
Migrate from keystoneclient to keystoneauth

keystoneauth was split out last cycle as a library specifically to deal
with doing auth functions so that people who do not need to do keystone
CRUD operations can just consume only the auth session parts.
Migrated piece of code using keystoneclient auth sessions to
keystoneauth.

bp: keystoneclient-to-keystoneauth

Change-Id: I99f99bae8cfb7462e5a9a10f2a559bdff7219634

Add centos-7 dib to all clouds

Refactor keystone tenant fetcher

readable.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/79/251179/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient import exceptions return self._get_tenants_v2_auth() elif discover.version_match((3,), keystone_version): return self._get_tenants_v3_auth() else: msg = "Keystone version you've specified is not supported" raise exceptions.VersionNotAvailable(msg) def _get_tenants_v2_auth(self): tenant_list = self.admin_ks.tenants.list() roles = self.admin_ks.roles.roles_for_user( my_user_id, tenant) def _get_tenants_v3_auth(self): tenant_list = self.admin_ks.projects.list() my_user_id = self.session.get_user_id() for tenant in tenant_list[:]: roles = self.admin_ks.roles.list(user=my_user_id, project=tenant) if 'rating' not in [role.name for role in roles]: tenant_list.remove(tenant) return [tenant.id for tenant in tenant_list]

commit_message:
Change heat domain to heat_user_domain

heat_user_domain is what is in the docs, but more importantly it is
what we have in Liberty and will be a requirement to doing upgrades
properly.

Change-Id: I9cf53d43b4faaa5d1b0156cc50192722d2739602
Closes-Bug: #1553565
(cherry picked from commit 5b18913f367b417941ac348a572152fedd5ff756)

added_lines: import flask def get_by_id_or_name(self, id_or_name): result = self.get(id_or_name) if result is None: result = self.filter_by(name=id_or_name).one_or_none() if result is None: flask.abort(404) return result

commit_message:
fix error reporting from shell and sync hooks

1. Report exit codes from nodes, where command execution
   failed. I've changed return value of function
   run_shell_command. Now it returns nil in case of
   success and string descrition in case of error.
2. Show different message for each exception handled
   in shell_hook.
3. Fix warning about number of retires.

I also think that it's better to increase timeout in
nailgun, so timeout will be greater than retries * interval,
in this case if command failed all times, the error will be
'Failed to run command', not about timeout.

Change-Id: I5051a84c9c146999ae7b3ef430ec3013989f1271
Closes-Bug: #1435603

commit_message:
Always delete exc_info tuple, even if reply fails

Avoid any possible references to exc_info tuple by ensuring
we delete it in a finally block, so that even if replying or
logging fails somehow the prior exception is always deleted
correctly.

Change-Id: Id0e5099b9b38b1803bb4514f7cf3deae760d5ac3
(cherry picked from commit 0774b5cebaadd5587724d59e64ddbe30ce11f6a5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/23/297623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: LOG.error(_LE('Exception during message handling: %s'), e, exc_info=exc_info) incoming.reply(failure=exc_info) finally: # NOTE(dhellmann): Remove circular object reference # between the current stack frame and the traceback in # exc_info. del exc_info
deleted_lines: LOG.error(_LE('Exception during message handling: %s'), e, exc_info=exc_info) incoming.reply(failure=exc_info) # NOTE(dhellmann): Remove circular object reference # between the current stack frame and the traceback in # exc_info. del exc_info

commit_message:
Fail quickly if there on bad password

Inspired by:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1508512/comments/1

Add authentication_failure_close capability on the client to
tell the server that it can send us connection.close command
indicating ACCESS_REFUSED as the reasona. If this capability is
absent then authentication failures are reported in the legacy
fashion: by abruptly closing the network connection.

Partial-Bug: #1508512
Change-Id: Icf6108678256e6f922620837c71f8827fe8e8c52
(cherry picked from commit 97655c1fe633f6b1340ce899bb1ad65284926399)

Glance: Incorrect Request parameters in "Show task details" API

This patch remove duplicate task_id row in Request Parameter table and
add response table to "Show task details" API.

commit_message:
Ensure metadata agent doesn't use SSL for UNIX socket

The communication between the ns metadata proxy and the metadata agent
is pure HTTP, and should not switch to HTTPS when neutron is using SSL.

We're therefore telling wsgi.Server to forcefully disable SSL in that
case.

Change-Id: I2cb9fa231193bcd5c721c4d5cf0eb9c16e842349
Closes-Bug: #1514424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/45/245945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.CONF.set_override('use_ssl', False)

commit_message:
Add testcase 'Run EDP job on cluster'

Testcase checks running edp job on cluster created with Fake Plugin in
Horizon dashboard

Change-Id: Ie6a785fec1319aa2742c8d4fab048733f68bcf1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/26/275126/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def run_edp_job(self): datasource_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_datasourcespage() input_name = gen_name('input') datasource_pg.create(name=input_name, source_type="HDFS", url="hdfs://user/input") output_name = gen_name('output') datasource_pg.create(name=output_name, source_type="Swift", url="swift://container/output") # create job binary job_binary_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_jobbinariespage() job_binary_name = gen_name('function') job_binary_pg.create_job_binary_from_file(job_binary_name, __file__) self.assertTrue(job_binary_pg.is_job_binary_present(job_binary_name), "Job binary is not in the binaries job table after" " its creation.") # create job template jobtemplates_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_jobtemplatespage() jobtemplate_name = gen_name('test-job') jobtemplates_pg.create(name=jobtemplate_name, job_type='Pig', binary_name=job_binary_name) # launch job jobtemplates_pg.launch_on_exists(job_name=jobtemplate_name, input_name=input_name, output_name=output_name, cluster_name=CLUSTER_NAME) jobs_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_jobspage() jobs_pg.wait_until_job_succeeded(jobtemplate_name) # delete job jobs_pg.delete(jobtemplate_name) # delete job_template jobtemplates_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_jobtemplatespage() jobtemplates_pg.delete(jobtemplate_name) # delete job binary job_binary_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_jobbinariespage() job_binary_pg.delete_job_binary(job_binary_name) self.assertFalse(job_binary_pg.is_job_binary_present(job_binary_name), "Job binary was not removed from binaries job table.") datasource_pg = self.home_pg.go_to_dataprocessing_datasourcespage() datasource_pg.delete(input_name) datasource_pg.delete(output_name) def test_run_edp_job(self): self.create_cluster() self.run_edp_job() self.delete_cluster()

subject: Pass parameter names from parameter_defaults to clear_parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 13:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/b7e5e7b5bcfc56b2c9a428bae771d8440428a199', 'message': "Pass parameter names from parameter_defaults to clear_parameters

There are parameters in TripleO which were previously fed via
`parameters` in enviornment files, and now they're fed via
`parameter_defaults`. This works as-is for new deployments, but it can
cause a problem on updates/upgrades, because we preserve old
`parameters` via passing `existing: true` to stack-update, and the old
`parameters` values always take precedence over
`parameter_defaults`.

This has already been partially fixed for values generated within
tripleoclient itself in change Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
but that change doesn't address other parameters which were passed in
via arbitrary environment files. This patch takes the same approach but
addresses also parameters not generated in tripleoclient itself.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Closes-Bug: 1559182
Change-Id: If690f9546930f822c77a89fcfec64faa277c2a31
(cherry picked from commit e933aeb69e3766efe937735e5ce07083d2f5dfcc)
"}]
commit_message:
Pass parameter names from parameter_defaults to clear_parameters

There are parameters in TripleO which were previously fed via
`parameters` in enviornment files, and now they're fed via
`parameter_defaults`. This works as-is for new deployments, but it can
cause a problem on updates/upgrades, because we preserve old
`parameters` via passing `existing: true` to stack-update, and the old
`parameters` values always take precedence over
`parameter_defaults`.

This has already been partially fixed for values generated within
tripleoclient itself in change Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
but that change doesn't address other parameters which were passed in
via arbitrary environment files. This patch takes the same approach but
addresses also parameters not generated in tripleoclient itself.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Closes-Bug: 1559182
Change-Id: If690f9546930f822c77a89fcfec64faa277c2a31
(cherry picked from commit e933aeb69e3766efe937735e5ce07083d2f5dfcc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/63/297163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'clear_parameters': env['parameter_defaults'].keys(),

commit_message:
Update fuel logs script

* Fix broken node name generation from log name
* Move log names to constants
* Rework logging
* Disable astute log parsing by default,
  it's useless anyway

Change-Id: I41e05951a3816ccf9e9dfb1a9e297527f185a341

commit_message:
Always display DELETE_IN_PROGRESS

When deleting a stack(s), sometimes the delete will complete before
the client makes a call to stack list, resulting in an output without
any reference to the deleted stack. This change will cause delete to
only print out the stacks being deleted, all with a status set to
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: I4da2986591cf057533289a40b436a42d73905083
Closes-Bug: #1396111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/40/290040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stacks = [] stacks.append(hc.stacks.get(**fields)) fields = ['id', 'stack_name', 'stack_status', 'creation_time', 'updated_time'] formatters = { 'stack_status': lambda x: 'DELETE_IN_PROGRESS' } utils.print_list(stacks, fields, formatters=formatters)

commit_message:
Handling of 'list index out of range' in neutron_l3_migration test.
nodes_with_l3 = os_conn.get_l3_agent_hosts(router_id)[0] could cause a
'list index out of range' exception if l3 agent hosting router with id
was not found.

Change-Id: Ic5df53191fbf57114f0c65fdf307a3e41a1db0a1
Closes-Bug: #1551696
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/27/293927/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nodes_with_l3 = os_conn.get_l3_agent_hosts(router_id) err_msg = ("Node with l3 agent from router:{r_id} after reset " "old node with l3 agent not found.") if not nodes_with_l3: raise NotFound(err_msg.format(router_id)) node_with_l3 = nodes_with_l3[0]

commit_message:
Extract strings from django templates

Also mark some strings translatable.

This commit violates hard string freeze after RC1 phase,
but this change only add new strings and allows translators
to translate strings which cannot be tranlated now.

Change-Id: Ia3b3889347c6ccb97488409f8409cb44d6a2586f
Closes-Bug: #1561203

UX improvements

Fix calendar to better display in small windows
Bump the number of results for listing items
Quick workaround to successfully listing items after being created

commit_message:
Remove property "ssh_authorized_key" from OS::Magnum::BayModel

This change marks the ssh_authorized_key property as HIDDEN from
resource OS::Magnum::BayModel due to magnum has removed it in this
patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274452/

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin.lu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I573918c77cf35fe98c6c0fb3eed7f70df39e03d0
Closes-Bug: #1560284

commit_message:
Add colorful PS4

PS4 can include functions, so when running in the LOG_COLORS=True mode
provide a grey function line so that it's easier to visually
distinguish the content from the location.

Also make it so the main prompt chunks off all the common path, which
means we can printf to 40 characters and have a pretty reasonable and
readable PS4.

Change-Id: I4a10a49db97d413349bcfceeb8c4164936fbcc40
(cherry picked from commit 646085d701049004f9b2bcdc38610f3e87579cda)

commit_message:
Send virtual sync node as nil node instead of 'null'

Now Nailgun support real nil(None) node, so we do not
need special convertation.

Change-Id: I53dd13424e21dba8fbae46252758f05699009770
Implements: blueprint store-deployment-tasks-history

commit_message:
Fix inconsistancy in globals.yml

The parameter values in global.yml were inconsist,
for some variable default values are shown while for
others it's not.

From user point of view it is important to know
the default values of the parameters and the globals.yml is
the file where user is supposed to look for config variable,
for sure a user do not want to look kolla/ansible/group_var/all.yml
file just for checking default values. So it is better to show all
default values in global.yml

This patch will solve this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I991fc5e1d4ed48d106da002a0f18a2b31525a482
(cherry picked from commit de695f04db8ba729b32b9ffa19d7f5e7ead615ec)

commit_message:
Clean thread local profiler object after usage

Currently profiler is initiated in the osprofiler wsgi
middleware, but is not cleaned up after this. This leaded to the
fact, that there is profiler object initiated if the thread
is reused, even if there was no hmac_key passed via next API
request to the traced service. For most of OpenStack projects this
was not influencing the fucntionality, as all requests were processed
in separated greenlets, but in Keystone there is reusable thread
pool. This leaded to the situation, when DB calls were continued
to be traced even if the original request was finished for a while
ago.

Change-Id: Ie84e1b28ac61c03b2619530e5d619855c5072207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/15/294515/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp = request.get_response(self.application) profiler._clean() return resp

keystonemiddleware, and pycadf.

commit_message:
config options: Move wsgi options into a group

Move all wsgi configuration into [wsgi] group. Update references to
these configuration options to reflect new group.

Change-Id: I1a0a0ce1b0c1bdf60114caf6f5d4e28fd2c3cda5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/263812/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wsgi_group = cfg.OptGroup( 'wsgi', title='WSGI Options') help='File name for the paste.deploy config for nova-api', deprecated_group='DEFAULT') 'body_length, wall_seconds.', deprecated_group='DEFAULT') '"HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO".', deprecated_group='DEFAULT') "connecting clients", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') help="SSL certificate of API server", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') help="SSL private key of API server", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') "server socket. Not supported on OS X.", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') help="Size of the pool of greenthreads used by wsgi", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') "Keystone v3 API with big service catalogs).", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') "explicitly.", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') "wait forever.", deprecated_group='DEFAULT') # Because of bug 1395819 in oslo.config we cannot pass in the OptGroup. # As soon as this bug is fixed is oslo.config and Nova uses the # version which contains this fix, we can pass in the OptGroup instead # of its name. This allows the generation of the group help too. return (wsgi_group.name, ALL_OPTS)
deleted_lines: help='File name for the paste.deploy config for nova-api') 'body_length, wall_seconds.') '"HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO".') "connecting clients") help="SSL certificate of API server") help="SSL private key of API server") "server socket. Not supported on OS X.") help="Size of the pool of greenthreads used by wsgi") "Keystone v3 API with big service catalogs).") "explicitly.") "wait forever.") return ("DEFAULT", ALL_OPTS)

commit_message:
Ensure error message written in log on master node bootstrap

Log message from fail() function [1] doesn't appear in logs,
because of output stream buffering issue [2], so we need to
flush data explicitly using sed.

This patch aligns testflow for master node wait_bootstrap
function [3], since we need to fail deployment ASAP rather then
wait for timeout

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/fuel-main/blob/master/iso/bootstrap_admin_node.sh#L113
[2]. http://www.pixelbeat.org/programming/stdio_buffering/
[3]. https://github.com/openstack/fuel-qa/blob/master/fuelweb_test/models/environment.py#L556

Closes-bug: #1551658
Related-bug #1549302

Change-Id: I3f0d48a8d5c3ce36dd01724f48d2a1180d2f5335

commit_message:
Adds genisoimage package dependency to nova-compute

- This change enables the nova-compute agent to generate
  config drives to attach the an instance.
- This allows the config drive to be used to pass
  cloud-init config files to a guest enableing first boot
  configuration.

Change-Id: Id17741b3fce1382350914c1b6c818b0020fe839a
Closes-Bug: #1538288

commit_message:
Better isolate tests and fixtures from environment

Remove a duplicate monkey patch as well as ensure that the
environment the test is running in does not influence the
test results (especially in regard to locale settings).

Change-Id: I2451240148bb329e0ff9aa01f279bde9711e599f

subject: Validate PUT of reserved queue attributes metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 04:30:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/0f6ef2e18e96a16f65cc7d75d20ed870a1e1db21', 'message': 'Validate PUT of reserved queue attributes metadata

We recently introduced reserved queue metadata feature in our API v2.
And because it's a feature of API v2, we decided not to change at all
our older APIs. But through our older APIs it's possible to PUT invalid
queue attributes, which can cause unstable work of API v2.

This patch makes API v1 restrict any metadata keys which names start
with "_", because they are probably reserved queue attributes.

This patch makes API v1.1 validate metadata like API v2 validates it now
to ensure that the reserved queue attributes have valid values, before
sending them to the database.

This patch also adds unit tests to APIs.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: 1557247

Change-Id: Idcd063787c8d8da49a9c3d126441f9336c85e7cd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-25 06:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/transport/wsgi/v1_0/metadata.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/transport/wsgi/v1/test_validation.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v1_1/queues.py', 'zaqar/tests/functional/wsgi/v1/test_queues.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/transport/wsgi/v1_1/test_validation.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/queues.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/da85355cf46551b72675a86d325eb55b6591035b', 'message': 'Validate PUT of reserved queue attributes metadata

We recently introduced reserved queue metadata feature in our API v2.
And because it's a feature of API v2, we decided not to change at all
our older APIs. But through our older APIs it's possible to PUT invalid
queue attributes, which can cause unstable work of API v2.

This patch makes API v1 restrict any metadata keys which names start
with "_", because they are probably reserved queue attributes.

This patch makes API v1.1 validate metadata like API v2 validates it now
to ensure that the reserved queue attributes have valid values, before
sending them to the database.

This patch also adds unit tests to APIs.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: 1557247

Change-Id: Idcd063787c8d8da49a9c3d126441f9336c85e7cd
(cherry picked from commit 400fc6ec7de96f1119fd4d9dc4130374d6ca5895)

commit_message:
Validate PUT of reserved queue attributes metadata

We recently introduced reserved queue metadata feature in our API v2.
And because it's a feature of API v2, we decided not to change at all
our older APIs. But through our older APIs it's possible to PUT invalid
queue attributes, which can cause unstable work of API v2.

This patch makes API v1 restrict any metadata keys which names start
with "_", because they are probably reserved queue attributes.

This patch makes API v1.1 validate metadata like API v2 validates it now
to ensure that the reserved queue attributes have valid values, before
sending them to the database.

This patch also adds unit tests to APIs.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: 1557247

Change-Id: Idcd063787c8d8da49a9c3d126441f9336c85e7cd
(cherry picked from commit 400fc6ec7de96f1119fd4d9dc4130374d6ca5895)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/10/297510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deserialize queue metadata metadata = None if req.content_length: document = wsgi_utils.deserialize(req.stream, req.content_length) metadata = wsgi_utils.sanitize(document, spec=None) self._validate.queue_metadata_putting(metadata) try:
deleted_lines: # Deserialize queue metadata metadata = None if req.content_length: document = wsgi_utils.deserialize(req.stream, req.content_length) metadata = wsgi_utils.sanitize(document, spec=None) try: self._validate.queue_metadata_putting(metadata) except validation.ValidationFailed as ex: LOG.debug(ex) raise wsgi_errors.HTTPBadRequestAPI(six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Specify API version in Keystone url

For now Aodh working with API v2.0 by default.
There are issues to migrate on third API version
quickly, but with current configuration
"aodh-evaluator" don't work.

Change-Id: I71a04dae92573aeb520117609c6a6630b72bdd03
Closes-bug: #1553078

commit_message:
Add ability to set kombu_compression for OpenStack components

Add posibility to set kombu_compression in OpenStack config files.
This option is disabled by default but its value can be overridden
from hiera. Also some checks were added to prevent from duplication
errors which can come from puppet-openstack patches similar to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292309/

Closes-bug: #1546554

Change-Id: I1a835f97c23073d3a450dd58decee2876bee53c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/45/296545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $kombu_compression = hiera('kombu_compression', '') # TODO (iberezovskiy): remove this workaround in N when heat module # will be switched to puppet-oslo usage for rabbit configuration if $kombu_compression in ['gzip','bz2'] { if !defined(Oslo::Messaging_rabbit['heat_config']) and !defined(Heat_config['oslo_messaging_rabbit/kombu_compression']) { heat_config { 'oslo_messaging_rabbit/kombu_compression': value => $kombu_compression; } } else { Heat_config<| title == 'oslo_messaging_rabbit/kombu_compression' |> { value => $kombu_compression } } }

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 18:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/64ce3e63cfbe9fc28531c523ab7bbf71cc481fb4', 'message': 'Fix satellite registration for http or https

To additionally handle the case where https is specified, also use curl
directly with -k to download the configuration rpm instead of using rpm

commit_message:
Fix satellite registration for http or https

If the satellite registration url was specified with https, the curl
command to detect the satellite version would not work as expected since
-L was not passed and you get redirected to https when testing the ping
api.

To additionally handle the case where https is specified, also use curl
directly with -k to download the configuration rpm instead of using rpm
with a url.

Fixes another bug with a missing $ in the reference to the
$satellite_version variable.

Change-Id: I984fdfc415eeeed4ef29cc8d0812e1b67545d6b1
(cherry picked from commit 51170114683e6d986b32aced253e5ebcf47fdedc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/84/297284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if curl -L -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $ping_api | grep "200 OK"; then elif curl -L -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $REG_SAT_URL/rhn/Login.do | grep "200 OK"; then if [ "$satellite_version" = "6" ]; then curl -L -k -O "$REG_SAT_URL/pub/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm" rpm -Uvh katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm || true
deleted_lines: if curl -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $ping_api | grep "200 OK"; then elif curl -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $REG_SAT_URL/rhn/Login.do | grep "200 OK"; then if [ "satellite_version" = "6" ]; then rpm -Uvh "$REG_SAT_URL/pub/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm" || true

commit_message:
nonha: fix memcached servers string in nova.conf for ipv6

Full context is described here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270110/

The patch that was supposed to fix [1] was not fixing non-ha scenario.
[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1536103

This patch aims to fix it.

Change-Id: Iaf4608de1894ce03f35925939e83230abb9f5207
Closes-Bug: #1560063
(cherry picked from commit 99c3db0ea146b55005848fd5230ca0bb63874f58)

added_lines: $nova_ipv6 = hiera('nova::use_ipv6', false) if $nova_ipv6 { $memcached_servers = suffix(hiera('memcache_node_ips_v6'), ':11211') } else { $memcached_servers = suffix(hiera('memcache_node_ips'), ':11211') } class { '::nova' : memcached_servers => $memcached_servers

subject: Always delete exc_info tuple, even if reply fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 19:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/0774b5cebaadd5587724d59e64ddbe30ce11f6a5', 'message': 'Always delete exc_info tuple, even if reply fails

Avoid any possible references to exc_info tuple by ensuring
we delete it in a finally block, so that even if replying or

Change-Id: Id0e5099b9b38b1803bb4514f7cf3deae760d5ac3
'}]
commit_message:
Always delete exc_info tuple, even if reply fails

Avoid any possible references to exc_info tuple by ensuring
we delete it in a finally block, so that even if replying or
logging fails somehow the prior exception is always deleted
correctly.

Change-Id: Id0e5099b9b38b1803bb4514f7cf3deae760d5ac3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/10/288710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: LOG.error(_LE('Exception during message handling: %s'), e, exc_info=exc_info) incoming.reply(failure=exc_info) finally: # NOTE(dhellmann): Remove circular object reference # between the current stack frame and the traceback in # exc_info. del exc_info
deleted_lines: LOG.error(_LE('Exception during message handling: %s'), e, exc_info=exc_info) incoming.reply(failure=exc_info) # NOTE(dhellmann): Remove circular object reference # between the current stack frame and the traceback in # exc_info. del exc_info

commit_message:
Fail quickly if there on bad password

Inspired by:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1508512/comments/1

Add authentication_failure_close capability on the client to
tell the server that it can send us connection.close command
indicating ACCESS_REFUSED as the reasona. If this capability is
absent then authentication failures are reported in the legacy
fashion: by abruptly closing the network connection.

Partial-Bug: #1508512
Change-Id: Icf6108678256e6f922620837c71f8827fe8e8c52

commit_message:
Remove the glance/rbd user name from static hieradata

The static setting for the glance/rbd user name was overriding
any customization provided via template param because it was
up in the hierarchy for the controller nodes.

More at: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1308889

Change-Id: I3d112de7eeffd524fb1308d5976a28f04aa5ff23
(cherry picked from commit ca0bd453d44ee27bdc1f4420fb584b6132d64df6)

commit_message:
Use safe methods to reach node attributes

Since UI blueprint input-type-number is not
implemented, it's possible that node attributes
can be string instead of number. Thus, it's
better to add safe methods that convert strings
to number. It will prevent different hacks with
converting string to integer.
Also, old releases doesn't contain node attributes
so it better to use safe methods.

Change-Id: I84ccc509c0635c9023cfc349b52df4cfa26318c9
Closes-Bug: #1558980

added_lines: def test_cpu_pinning_disabled(self): nodes_roles = [['compute'], ['controller']] for roles in nodes_roles: self.env.create_node( cluster_id=self.cluster_db.id, roles=roles) objects.Cluster.prepare_for_deployment(self.cluster_db) serialized_for_astute = self.serializer.serialize( self.cluster_db, self.cluster_db.nodes) for serialized_node in serialized_for_astute: nova = serialized_node.get('nova', {}) self.assertNotIn('cpu_pinning', nova) dpdk = serialized_node.get('dpdk', {}) self.assertNotIn('ovs_core_mask', dpdk) self.assertNotIn('ovs_pmd_core_mask', dpdk) nodes_attrs = serialized_node['network_metadata']['nodes'] for node_attrs in nodes_attrs.values(): self.assertFalse(node_attrs['nova_cpu_pinning_enabled']) def test_hugepages_disabled(self): nodes_roles = [['compute'], ['controller']] for roles in nodes_roles: self.env.create_node( cluster_id=self.cluster_db.id, roles=roles) objects.Cluster.prepare_for_deployment(self.cluster_db) serialized_for_astute = self.serializer.serialize( self.cluster_db, self.cluster_db.nodes) for serialized_node in serialized_for_astute: nova = serialized_node.get('nova', {}) self.assertFalse(nova.get('enable_hugepages', False)) dpdk = serialized_node.get('dpdk', {}) self.assertNotIn('ovs_socket_mem', dpdk) self.assertNotIn('hugepages', serialized_node) nodes_attrs = serialized_node['network_metadata']['nodes'] for node_attrs in nodes_attrs.values(): self.assertFalse(node_attrs['nova_hugepages_enabled'])

Fix filter of nodes available for provisioning

* error nodes with 'error_type' = 'provision' attribute
  are available for provisioning

commit_message:
Add possibility to set number of sequiential deploys

New task-based deployment and testing strategy for fuel-library LCM readiness
requires tests for several layers. In the most common case it is just rerun deploy
for ready cluster without any changes. Second deploy should not break anything.

New environment variable DEPLOYMENT_RETRIES will allow us to rerun system test
in a several-in-a-row-deploy way and be sure that additional deploys don't break
that test.

Implements: blueprint fuel-qa-deploy-retries

Change-Id: I2b7b6933f9a331fa9f2c16f3893d4aa39d094355

subject: Handling concurrent transactions in metadata_set method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 06:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service_software_config.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/71861f4f7c8063e618f95a72271ad0851e113f8f', 'message': "Handling concurrent transactions in metadata_set method

There are follow changes in this patch:
 - Using exception ConcurrentTransactions for processing
   concurrent transactions during writing metadata.
 - wrapper @retry_on_conflict was used for metadata_set method to
   allow retrying in the event of a race. The same wrapper was added for
   _push_metadata_software_deployments method.
 - added new parameter for metadata_set method - merge_metadata.
   When RetryRequest exception is raised, oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry
   re-call metadata_set method and in this case we need to refresh
   old metadata. It's mostly need for signals without data and id.
   For example:
     A and B signals come in the same moment and both get number 1,
   because metadata was empty. Then during write in db RetryRequest
   exception was raised for signal B. Metadata of this signal stores old
   number - 1. So we should re-calculate this value using new length
   of metadata and set number - 2.

Change-Id: I1ddbad7cde3036cfa9310c670609fcde607ffcac
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Partially-Bug: #1497274
(cherry picked from commit 82b744042e39529eaca6660704ad4923c2442be9)
"}]
commit_message:
Handling concurrent transactions in metadata_set method

There are follow changes in this patch:
 - Using exception ConcurrentTransactions for processing
   concurrent transactions during writing metadata.
 - wrapper @retry_on_conflict was used for metadata_set method to
   allow retrying in the event of a race. The same wrapper was added for
   _push_metadata_software_deployments method.
 - added new parameter for metadata_set method - merge_metadata.
   When RetryRequest exception is raised, oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry
   re-call metadata_set method and in this case we need to refresh
   old metadata. It's mostly need for signals without data and id.
   For example:
     A and B signals come in the same moment and both get number 1,
   because metadata was empty. Then during write in db RetryRequest
   exception was raised for signal B. Metadata of this signal stores old
   number - 1. So we should re-calculate this value using new length
   of metadata and set number - 2.

Change-Id: I1ddbad7cde3036cfa9310c670609fcde607ffcac
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Partially-Bug: #1497274
(cherry picked from commit 82b744042e39529eaca6660704ad4923c2442be9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/12/296912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @resource_objects.retry_on_conflict def metadata_set(self, metadata, merge_metadata=None): """Write new metadata to the database. The caller may optionally provide a merge_metadata() function, which takes two arguments - the metadata passed to metadata_set() and the current metadata of the resource - and returns the merged metadata to write. If merge_metadata is not provided, the metadata passed to metadata_set() is written verbatim, overwriting any existing metadata. If a race condition is detected, the write will be retried with the new result of merge_metadata() (if it is supplied) or the verbatim data (if it is not). """ db_res = resource_objects.Resource.get_obj(self.stack.context, self.id) if merge_metadata is not None: db_res = db_res.refresh(attrs=['rsrc_metadata']) metadata = merge_metadata(metadata, db_res.rsrc_metadata) db_res.update_metadata(metadata)
deleted_lines: def metadata_set(self, metadata): resource_objects.Resource.update_by_id( self.stack.context, self.id, {'rsrc_metadata': metadata})

commit_message:
[Verify] Set time precision to 3 digits (instead of 5) after dot

The time precision in reports for Rally scenarios is set to 3 digits
after the dot. So it would be nice to have the same time precision in
"verify" command to be consistent with Rally scenarios.

Change-Id: I379c36731c488411ace3e39b67b42fcffa6495fa

commit_message:
Add stable:follows-policy to several Neutron deliverables

For now, use the new tag for the following repos:

- neutron + neutron-*aas
- octavia [as part of neutron-lbaas]
- neutron-lib
- python-neutronclient

Other projects under Neutron stadium are left intact while stadium
discussion is ongoing in the community.

Change-Id: I2ee25b00312f92fa4b52a8f7175d82e6016c22b5

commit_message:
Add missed glare_config options for glance::config class

Change I3371d1d57486e79ccfae565417f2195d3ae66bc9 is introduced a new
glance service - Glare, but it missed options for glance::config

Also this patch adds tests for glance::config class

Change-Id: Ie07480562b2c0761f5218eb00b3ed3f335bd7cfb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/90/296390/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*glare_config*] # (optional) Allow configuration of glance-api.conf configurations. # # [*glare_paste_ini_config*] # (optional) Allow configuration of glance-api-paste.ini configurations. # $glare_config = {}, $glare_paste_ini_config = {}, validate_hash($glare_config) validate_hash($glare_paste_ini_config) create_resources('glance_glare_config', $api_config) create_resources('glance_glare_paste_ini', $api_paste_ini_config)
