commit_message:
Update ironic_ssh_check method

Use cyclic check that allows to see if an error is occurred
during testing SSH connection to devstack host.
Add new variabled IRONIC_SSH_ATTEMPTS which defines number of
failed attempts before mark build as failed.

Closes-Bug: 1557506

Change-Id: If46271db24ae8de416334fca0c96888dfdeef64a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/73/293373/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_SSH_ATTEMPTS=${IRONIC_SSH_ATTEMPTS:-5} local attempt=$5 local status=false local ssh_options="-o BatchMode=yes -o ConnectTimeout=$IRONIC_SSH_TIMEOUT -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" while [[ $attempt -gt 0 ]]; do ssh -p 22 $ssh_options -i $key_file ${default_instance_user}@$floating_ip exit if [[ "$?" == "0" ]]; then status=true break fi echo "SSH connection failed. $attempt left." attempt=$((attempt - 1)) done if ! $status; then die $LINENO "server didn't become ssh-able!" fi ironic_ssh_check $IRONIC_KEY_FILE $IRONIC_VM_SSH_ADDRESS $IRONIC_VM_SSH_PORT $IRONIC_SSH_USERNAME $IRONIC_SSH_ATTEMPTS
deleted_lines: local active_timeout=$5 if ! timeout $active_timeout sh -c "while ! ssh -p $port -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -i $key_file ${default_instance_user}@$floating_ip echo success; do sleep 1; done"; then die $LINENO "server didn't become ssh-able!" fi ironic_ssh_check $IRONIC_KEY_FILE $IRONIC_VM_SSH_ADDRESS $IRONIC_VM_SSH_PORT $IRONIC_SSH_USERNAME $IRONIC_SSH_TIMEOUT

subject: Config to stop powering off nodes on failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 17:24:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/db73ac4aad1bc9c29e46cca30347336a8da74b0c', 'message': 'Config to stop powering off nodes on cleanfail

Powering off nodes on cleanfail means loss of the log output from the
agent. Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system.

Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 17:35:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/588c4f9778dfb7be2c1d45e99e25a1cf5a113804', 'message': 'Config to stop powering off nodes on failure

This adds two config options: one will prevent powering off nodes on
cleanfail, another will prevent powering off nodes in deployfail.

Powering off nodes on failure means loss of the log output from the
agent. Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system.

As a note, Nova will still attempt to delete the node on a failed
deployment, so the deploy.power_off_after_failure option will not be
very effective in non-standalone deployments.

Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-04 00:32:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/938cb512233d5c595783ed6c4d0fb1733c7adf8e', 'message': 'Config to stop powering off nodes on failure

This adds two config options: one will prevent powering off nodes on
cleanfail, another will prevent powering off nodes in deployfail.

Powering off nodes on failure means loss of the log output from the
agent. Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system.

As a note, Nova will still attempt to delete the node on a failed
deployment, so the deploy.power_off_after_failure option will not be
very effective in non-standalone deployments.

Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-05 18:39:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5f4db271eb417e552bce6e23697903ad7f030871', 'message': 'Config to stop powering off nodes on failure

This adds two config options:

deploy.power_off_after_cleaning, default True, will prevent powering
off nodes after cleaning when set to False.

deploy.power_off_after_deploy_failure will prevent powering off nodes
once a deployment fails.

Powering off nodes means loss of the log output from the agent.
Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system in case of failure, or to prevent needing to power the machine
back on for provisioning after cleaning.

As a note, Nova will still attempt to delete the node on a failed
deployment, so the deploy.power_off_after_failure option will not be
very effective in non-standalone deployments.

Closes-bug: 1531217
Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>

Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system in case of failure, or to prevent needing to power the machine
back on for provisioning after cleaning.

As a note, Nova will still attempt to delete the node on a failed
deployment, so the option will not be very effective in non-standalone
deployments until a similar patch is put into nova.

Related-bug: 1531217
Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Config to stop powering off nodes on failure

This adds the config option deploy.power_off_after_deploy_failure,
which will prevent powering off nodes once a deployment fails.

Powering off nodes means loss of the log output from the agent.
Choosing to leave the machine powered on would give an operator
the opportunity to troubleshoot the issue using agent logs on the
system in case of failure, or to prevent needing to power the machine
back on for provisioning after cleaning.

As a note, Nova will still attempt to delete the node on a failed
deployment, so the option will not be very effective in non-standalone
deployments until a similar patch is put into nova.

Related-bug: 1531217
Change-Id: I7c25946de50ffda2869307cb4016e0ccfe81d192
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>

commit_message:
Update authorized_keys with new key only

New ssh-key is generated only if IRONIC_KEY_FILE doesn't exist. At the
moment it is always added to authorized_keys file.
As result key may be added to authorized_keys several times.
This commit check if key exists in autorized file before adding it.

Change-Id: Idc1603d7f6d849d9c1a745b6d50d75ceb414d5c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/93/295293/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local key key=$(cat $IRONIC_KEY_FILE.pub) grep -vq "$key" $IRONIC_AUTHORIZED_KEYS_FILE && (cat $IRONIC_KEY_FILE.pub | tee -a $IRONIC_AUTHORIZED_KEYS_FILE)

commit_message:
Make pypy-db jobs also non-voting

The switch to pypy-db jobs for some projects made these voting but pypy
jobs should be non-voting. enhance regex to handle both pypy and pypy-db
jobs.

Change-Id: I9c37a9f06c823de8ce0247c986010d9a733075b6

commit_message:
Handle tempurl Content-Disposition header missing from HEAD

Content-Disposition headers should make no difference between
GET and HEAD according to HTTP rfc.

Closes-Bug: #1539805

Change-Id: Ifa41a7cda2f321eb8e36420ede7912ed0a549712

%s

commit_message:
Move region configuration to a critical section

Cache initialization performed on the request handling
after Apache wsgi module start raises exception
region.RegionAlreadyConfigured on race condition
in multithreaded mode.

Change-Id: I65f85aedd5b087499b889540417b9502e050ce7c
Closes-bug: 1482271

deleted_lines: if not self._store.is_configured: # Do not re-configure the backend if the store has been initialized self._store.configure(backing_store=self.kvs_backend, **kwargs)

subject: Fix correct foreign key constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 17:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/model/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/795737bb3c3_change_tenants_to_projects.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/f47ae83656966657a43487de22285428cfdb41ab', 'message': 'Fix correct foreign key constraints

In the orders table the wrong foreign key was being deleted and a
foreign key was also missing and needs to be explicitly created.
This patch make sure those items are fixed when using the alembic
migration process via the barbican-manage command instead of the
auto populate process.

Change-Id: Ie9a6722c3e9b661d8e0dabff836b5a988d720e98
Closes-Bug: 1556256
'}]
commit_message:
Fix correct foreign key constraints

In the orders table the wrong foreign key was being deleted and a
foreign key was also missing and needs to be explicitly created.
This patch make sure those items are fixed when using the alembic
migration process via the barbican-manage command instead of the
auto populate process.

Change-Id: Ie9a6722c3e9b661d8e0dabff836b5a988d720e98
Closes-Bug: 1556256

commit_message:
Updated repo_build process to be faster

The repo_build process is slow and can do with some improvement.
To achieve better speed of execution some several slow tasks,
as profiled by the integrated gate have been moved into executable
scripts using jobs. These scripts are generated from the playbooks
and the Jinja2 variables created during the repo_build run time and
make it possible to perform multiple actions in parallel. In test
the results were significantly faster[0].

The test case has been updated to build all of the packages known
to exist and be required for a real OpenStack environment.

[0] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/491537/

Change-Id: I3a1872741a17dee25054a340859333b96203ca15
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/40/296840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: repo_build_concurrency: "{{ ansible_processor_count | default(5) }}"

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 19:55:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_host.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/host.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1a0e8fce204fa99290de4d6f886371c80ecd2b48', 'message': "libvirt: don't attempt to get baseline cpu features if host cpu model is None

In certain cases, libvirt can't determine the host's CPU model.

This is fine when you're setting virt_type=qemu and cpu_mode=none,
for example (like with nested virtualization).

If we can't determine the host's cpu model, don't attempt to get

Change-Id: I81ae5a04c7b4eb84e976902a575d890d4e850151

commit_message:
libvirt: don't attempt to get baseline cpu features if host cpu model is None

In certain cases, libvirt can't determine the host's CPU model.

This is fine when you're setting virt_type=qemu and cpu_mode=none,
for example (like with nested virtualization).

If we can't determine the host's cpu model, don't attempt to get
cpu features on startup of the compute service (since it will
crash the service).

Change-Id: I81ae5a04c7b4eb84e976902a575d890d4e850151
Closes-Bug: #1447342
(cherry picked from commit 04bbf658e7998d40ffbdb2b6467dfab8dc5fde55)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 15:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/414bf3b7eb0f0f4914c1cb2118a306c13b9e0e8d', 'message': "kilo: cap diskimage-builder<1.1.2

Kilo caps pbr<1.0 but doesn't cap diskimage-builder. The
latest version of diskimage-builder doesn't have a cap on
pbr so it pulls in the latest.

The ironic setup script in kilo devstack installs diskimage-builder
from global-requirements, so this pulls in the latest pbr which
breaks the cap set in place in kilo g-r.

Then later when python-openstackclient from kilo is used in kilo
devstack, it fails because of the version conflict on pbr.

requires pbr>=1.3 (dib 1.1.2 should have really been 1.2 but we

Change-Id: I6ac655aad87da40ee214a7bcec1b43e8ba6e5416
"}]
commit_message:
kilo: cap diskimage-builder<1.1.2

Kilo caps pbr<1.0 but doesn't cap diskimage-builder. The
latest version of diskimage-builder doesn't have a cap on
pbr so it pulls in the latest.

The ironic setup script in kilo devstack installs diskimage-builder
from global-requirements, so this pulls in the latest pbr which
breaks the cap set in place in kilo g-r.

Then later when python-openstackclient from kilo is used in kilo
devstack, it fails because of the version conflict on pbr.

This caps diskimage-builder<1.1.2 because the 1.1.2 version
requires pbr>=1.3 (dib 1.1.2 should have really been 1.2 but we
can't fix that now).

Change-Id: I6ac655aad87da40ee214a7bcec1b43e8ba6e5416
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/55/296555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: diskimage-builder>=0.1.20,<1.1.2

commit_message:
Fix fullstack LB agent not connecting to rabbit

Using the broadcast address of a network is not going to work
very well.

It's still possible for different LB agents (From the same test)
to pick the same address, and that will be handled in a follow up
via some sort of atomic resource allocation mechanism.

Change-Id: I666cf7dbe5dd6a0eaf4130ee1e52cf29edb2ddca
Related-Bug: #1561248

commit_message:
Fix setting peer to bridge interfaces

OVSDB implementation refuses to set options:peer column value
 as there is no such column in the Interface table. The correct way
 is to set 'options' column value to a map containing key 'peer', as
 already used in ovs_lib.

Change-Id: Ib5e956f425b36f54cda017c91ac71d9d7ee9747c
Closes-Bug: 1528894

commit_message:
devstack: Add Skydive for OVN devstack

Skydive [1] is a network topology and protocol analyzer which aims
to enable easier debugging and visibility into OVS and OVN networks.
Skydive is disabled by default.

We can merge this now since it's disabled by default, but for
Skydive to work with multi-node devstack, we need the patches
in this [2] series to merge into the Skydive repository.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-cip/skydive
[2] http://softwarefactory-project.io/r/#/c/3308/

Change-Id: Ifebb74a33413518cadf392644aed1d62a6a87b13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/60/296860/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skydive enable_plugin skydive https://github.com/redhat-cip/skydive.git enable_service skydive-agent

commit_message:
Fix HNAS driver thin_provisioning support

Manila HNAS driver is currently not reporting thin_provisioning
support. Fixed by adding it to the _update_share_stats method.

Change-Id: Icf08426a2219dc8144752eddd3faf2c1bd3a65d7
Closes-bug: #1555030
(cherry-picked from commit adb6fa1eacade3b7c4a6caa90f303d4d4398d231)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/293389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'thin_provisioning': True, return hnas_id

commit_message:
Fixes truncated string in details overview table.

In current solution tooltip with full string is showing when hover over.
It use template approach.
This patch affects all themes.

Change-Id: I60162a2c313d08b9ba44484636c72955f8816c1e
Closes-Bug: 1443526
Closes-Bug: 1443539

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-23 08:09:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b1fe344f5ffdcec237f45d9c2055e59b7b1f6765', 'message': 'Ignore errors in HA router race condition

Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call and HA port deleting, HA router may not be able to
init its keepalived_manager. And then it will not be able
to remove the router_info from l3 agent.
So this patch slightly catch and ignore some exceptions in race between
HA router create and HA router delete.

Dependencies:
    "Make object creation methods in l3_hamode_db atomic"
        - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238122/

Revert:
    "Add transaction for setting agent_id in L3HARouterAgentPortBinding"
        - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227821/

Change-Id: I81fdd2c971ee4ae5133126b6887ba6ad855ef138
Closes-Bug: #1523780
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-23 08:17:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d4e21df57c5c26f98140d223ee66a8f5123d92ec', 'message': 'Ignore errors in HA router race condition

Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call and HA port deleting, HA router may not be able to
init its keepalived_manager. And then it will not be able
to remove the router_info from l3 agent.
So this patch slightly catch and ignore some exceptions in race between
HA router create and HA router delete.

Dependencies:
    "Add UniqueConstraint in L3HARouterAgentPortBinding"
        - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/230481/

Closes-Bug: #1523780
Related-Bug: #1510757

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-24 03:51:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bf311f26cb539421a93f39dedaec37aee89f0240', 'message': 'Ignore errors in HA router race condition

Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call and HA port deleting, HA router may not be able to
init its keepalived_manager. And then it will not be able
to remove the router_info from l3 agent.
So this patch slightly catch and ignore some exceptions in race between
HA router create and HA router delete.

Revert:
    "Add transaction for setting agent_id in L3HARouterAgentPortBinding"
        - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227821/

Change-Id: I81fdd2c971ee4ae5133126b6887ba6ad855ef138
Closes-Bug: #1523780
Related-Bug: #1510757
'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-04 08:48:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/08bbeae95a13b88fa678bfd592d0fc481f828924', 'message': "Catch exceptions in HA router race conditions

1. Race between HA router create and delete

Exception 1: HA router has no ha interface.
Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deleting,
neutron server side _process_sync_ha_data may get
a HA router without ha interface information, then l3
agent may not be able to init its keepalived_manager.
Finally the router will not be able to remove from the
l3 agent router_info.

Exception 2: HA router has no ha port binding.
If auto_scheduler the router, during the race, the neutron server may
treat the HA router as 'no scheduled', then it will create a new HA
port binding with the router(id) which is deleted concurrently, and
then foreign key constraint error(Integrity Error) raised.

Exception 3: ml2 plugin unable to update HA port status.
This happened between L2 agent and neutron server side ml2 plugin.
When l2 agent try to get port details, ml2 plugin will try to
get/update a HA port, but the HA port was deleted by a router
delete api, then the exception raised.

2. Race between tenant last HA router delete and create

To delete last HA router will also delete the HA network
concurrently, race happened between deleting the HA network
and a new HA router API call. Exceptions: NetworkNotFound
and IpAddressGenerationFailure.

If we can ensure that all the information of a HA router was deleted in
both neutron server side and l3 agent side after a DELETE api call,
we can just slightly catch and ignore some exceptions raised by race
conditions between HA router create and HA router delete.

Change-Id: I81fdd2c971ee4ae5133126b6887ba6ad855ef138
Closes-Bug: #1523780
Related-Bug: #1510757
"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-01-05 02:24:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/17a25c3d80cfa4b4a9c9b7c31537fe262f7acbcf', 'message': "Catch exceptions in HA router race conditions

1. Race between HA router create and delete

Exception 1: HA router has no ha interface.
Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deleting,
neutron server side _process_sync_ha_data may get
a HA router without ha interface information, then l3
agent may not be able to init its keepalived_manager.
Finally the router will not be able to remove from the
l3 agent router_info.

Exception 2: HA router has no ha port binding.
If auto_scheduler the router, during the race, the neutron server may
treat the HA router as 'no scheduled', then it will create a new HA
port binding with the router(id) which is deleted concurrently, and
then foreign key constraint error(Integrity Error) raised.

Exception 3: ml2 plugin unable to update HA port status.
This happened between L2 agent and neutron server side ml2 plugin.
When l2 agent try to get port details, ml2 plugin will try to
get/update a HA port, but the HA port was deleted by a router
delete api, then the exception raised.

2. Race between tenant last HA router delete and create

To delete last HA router will also delete the HA network
concurrently, race happened between deleting the HA network
and a new HA router API call. Exceptions: NetworkNotFound
and IpAddressGenerationFailure.

This patch slightly catch and ignore some exceptions raised
by race conditions between HA router create and HA router delete,
and also ensure that all the information of a HA router
was deleted in both neutron server side and l3 agent side after
a DELETE api call.

Change-Id: I81fdd2c971ee4ae5133126b6887ba6ad855ef138
Closes-Bug: #1523780
Related-Bug: #1510757

commit_message:
Catch DBReferenceError in HA router race conditions

If auto_scheduler the router, during the race, the neutron server may
treat the HA router as 'no scheduled', then it will create a new HA
port binding with the router(id) which is deleted concurrently, and
then foreign key constraint error(Integrity Error) raised.

Change-Id: I81fdd2c971ee4ae5133126b6887ba6ad855ef138
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Related-Bug: #1523780

from the readme with some minor adjustments for titles and separating
content into sections.

added_lines: Installation ============ Syntribos can be `installed with pip <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip>`__ from the git repository. - Clone the repository and install it using pip :: $ git clone https://github.com/openstack/syntribos.git $ cd syntribos $ pip install . --upgrade - To enable autocomplete for Syntribos, run the command. :: $ . scripts/syntribos-completion - Create a directory named .opencafe in the user's home directory, or in the case of a python virtualenv, in the virtualenv root folder. :: $ cafe-config init - Install the http library that gives you the minimum plugins required to use Syntribos. :: $ cafe-config plugins install http

commit_message:
Add systemctl reload haproxy to the pacemaker_resource_restart.sh

As discussed in the related bug below, after upgrading your
environment to latest liberty the haproxy config isn't picked
up. This adds a systemctl reload haproxy in the pacemaker
resource restart we run as part of the post-puppet-pacemaker.

Related-Bug: 1561012
Change-Id: Iae3bad745ecdf952a7a0314fe1375d07eb47c454
(cherry picked from commit 843d25af04f58d033e12c2c3d619303d7fd8bb02)

added_lines: if [[ -n "$IRONIC_TERMINAL_CERT_DIR" ]]; then iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE console terminal_cert_dir $IRONIC_TERMINAL_CERT_DIR # Generate the SSL certificate cd $IRONIC_TERMINAL_CERT_DIR openssl genrsa -des3 -out my.key 1024 openssl req -new -key my.key -out my.csr cp my.key my.key.org openssl rsa -in my.key.org -out my.key openssl x509 -req -days 3650 -in my.csr -signkey my.key -out my.crt cat my.crt my.key > certificate.pem cd - fi

commit_message:
Allow the Redis specific monitor to use authentication

When accessing Redis, if password protected, we need to update
the HAProxy checks so that they use a password or we won't be able
to gather which node is the replica master.

Also adds PING/PONG and QUIT/OK sequence before and after the info
command is sent.

More at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1320036

Change-Id: Ia9e61e66c5426061eab8172f0a25820989597780
(cherry picked from commit 410b9f96c0ec156ffeb00f31293735b120eaa260)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/15/297115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# [*redis_password*] # (optional) Password for Redis authentication, eventually needed by the # specific monitoring we do from HAProxy for Redis # Defaults to undef # $redis_password = undef, if $redis_password { $redis_tcp_check_options = ["send AUTH\ ${redis_password}\r\n"] } else { $redis_tcp_check_options = [] } 'tcp-check' => union($redis_tcp_check_options, ['send PING
','expect string +PONG','send info\ replication
','expect string role:master','send QUIT
','expect string +OK']),

commit_message:
Add experimental job to test TLS proxy in devstack

Enable the tlsproxy service in devstack which will add a TLS proxy
for most services. This will serve as a backstop to ensure that
TLS works between the configured services.

Keystone is explicitly configured to use mod_wsgi so that it runs
with Apache instead of eventlet.

Change-Id: I51b897fd378862ef99446ad010a5c7805a4123e2

commit_message:
Fix voting for amqp1-centos oslo.messaging jobs

Looks like we left out one entry that ended up making
gate-oslo.messaging-dsvm-functional-py27-amqp1-centos7
as a voting job for stable/mitaka. We should disable
voting for that job.

This job should not run on kilo and liberty

Change-Id: I033f301f4260b635a55719a4aa11ff32c9b794f6

commit_message:
update branches reported to #openstack-qa

This updates the branches that we report content to #openstack-qa. We
add mitaka, and drop juno. Devstack and grenade are branched, and
knowing about stable branches is good.

commit_message:
fuel-ostf: use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
These repo need databases setup for tests.

Change-Id: I9448b0be4562d0aee92527b09143e04455c4b8c4

commit_message:
Check marker params in SimpleClient full listing requests

Follow up for change [1] to add some assertions to check that
marker param is included in sequential GET requests sent during
a full listing.

Extract multiple FakeConn class definitions to single class at
module level and share between all classes.

Also, explicitly unpack the return values from base request calls
made in the full listing section of base_request, and explicitly
return a list to make more consistent with rest of the method.

[1] Change-Id: I6892390d72f70f1bc519b482d4f72603e1570163

Change-Id: Iad038709f46364b8324d25ac79be4317add79df5

commit_message:
Fix full_listing in internal_client

The internal_client is used in swift-dispersion-report, and in case one has more
than 10000 containers or objects these are not queried.

This patch adds support to the internal_client to iterate over all
containers/objects if the listing exceeds the default of 10000 entries and the
argument full_listing=True is used.

Closes-Bug: 1314817
Closes-Bug: 1525995
Change-Id: I6892390d72f70f1bc519b482d4f72603e1570163

commit_message:
Move wait_for_resource_status()

wait_for_resource_status() is used in DeletableResource only,
and some arguments are not used at all.
So this patch moves the method into DeletableResource and removes
unsed arguments for the cleanup.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I036822bfd689ed6d2ce23e7c519174cad8db2a7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/81/295481/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def wait_for_resource_status(self, fetch, status, interval=None, timeout=None): """Waits for a network resource to reach a status @param fetch: the callable to be used to query the resource status @type fecth: callable that takes no parameters and returns the resource @param status: the status that the resource has to reach @type status: String @param interval: the number of seconds to wait between each status query @type interval: Integer @param timeout: the maximum number of seconds to wait for the resource to reach the desired status @type timeout: Integer """ if not interval: interval = self.build_interval if not timeout: timeout = self.build_timeout start_time = time.time() while time.time() - start_time <= timeout: resource = fetch() if resource['status'] == status: return time.sleep(interval) # At this point, the wait has timed out message = 'Resource %s' % (str(resource)) message += ' failed to reach status %s' % status message += ' (current: %s)' % resource['status'] message += ' within the required time %s' % timeout caller = misc.find_test_caller() if caller: message = '(%s) %s' % (caller, message) raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message)

commit_message:
Move list_dhcp_agents_on_hosting_network()

list_dhcp_agents_on_hosting_network() sends a request to a resource
'/networks', so the method should be implemented in networks_client
for the consistent interfaces of tempest.lib.
This patch moves the method into networks_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I46afe15452764fd2db7fce5d91096507e23aa4d6

commit_message:
Add iSCSI MPIO support

Until now, even if there were multiple paths on which we could
access a volume, we were estabilishing a single iSCSI session.

This patch changes this, so we may use all the targets/portals
that we retrieve in the connection info.

Also, a config option was added so that the deployer can request
which initiators will be used for estabilishing the session, for
example forcing some hardware initiators to be used. If none is
explicitly requested, we let the iSCSI initiator service pick one.

This will also require the MPIO service to be enabled and properly
configured, in order to claim the disks.

Change-Id: Ia5c0aa81d56bb862b3b30de4b782d9d1d15d44f5

commit_message:
tuning-box: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I71e2f478577cd3ac2776ab242bdfd91173f9f437

commit_message:
Raise OperationInProgres(400) when deleting bay conflict

Heat client will raise HTTPConflict(409) when try to delete a
in-progress stack, this will lead Magnum 500 erro, mapping HTTPConflict
to OperationInProgres(400)

Closes-Bug: #1559803
Change-Id: Ia1795b0f75952db9c8c84c45e03c7674ed8cf64e

Change sorted order of alarm state and severity

From lowest to highest
State - "OK", "Undetermined", "Alarm"
Severity - "Low", "Medium", "High", "Critical"

Change-Id: I6b2b4a6d34064b8fda49ba1e0854353dde56378d

commit_message:
Change nesting API calls to promise chain in test-details controller

TestDetailsCtrl previously used a series of nesting API calls to
dataset-service in order to get dataset, raw json, and details json
for the test details page. This replaces the nesting calls with a
promise chain to make the code more 'Angular-y'.

Change-Id: I82ab7935280d657dc556d72159f5d1b84ca83c0d

deleted_lines: datasetService.get($stateParams.datasetId).then(function(response) { vm.dataset = response; vm.stats = response.stats; datasetService.raw(response).then(function(raw) { }).catch(function(ex) { $log.error(ex); progressService.done(); }); datasetService.details(response).then(function(deets) { }).catch(function(ex) { $log.error(ex); }).catch(function(ex) { $log.error(ex); progressService.done(); });

subject: Fall back to empty requires list if they are not set in the task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-15 16:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/task_based_deployment.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/53bac928b0c9930cc4b024092806ecc1812caa96', 'message': "Fall back to empty requires list if they are not set in the task

Do not fail if requires/required_for field is missing in the task.
With 2.0.0 tasks version requires/required_for fields can be
replaced with cross-depends/cross-depended-by with role name set to
'self' easily.

Change-Id: I555027cf00f935164ea6105bb1b9ca48a0d84ee1
Closes-bug: #1557615
"}]
commit_message:
Fall back to empty requires list if they are not set in the task

Do not fail if requires/required_for field is missing in the task.
With 2.0.0 tasks version requires/required_for fields can be
replaced with cross-depends/cross-depended-by with role name set to
'self' easily.

Change-Id: I555027cf00f935164ea6105bb1b9ca48a0d84ee1
Closes-bug: #1557615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/30/293030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: node_id, task.pop('requires', None), node_id, task.pop('required_for', None),

commit_message:
Fix for broken antlr3 in stand-alone install

Restored and updated the permanent symlinks and updated setup.cfg
to facilitate proper standalone installation of antlr3 w congress.

Change-Id: I7b603bcf3785374d5e83d0e5a98669dbd93d8cd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/89/297289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move openstack specific tasks to their own folder structure

In order to better support loose coupling of openstack version to fuel
we need to separate the tasks that call into the specific version of the
puppet-openstack modules so that they can more easily be versioned from
their fuel version.

Initially we are separating them, later they will become their own
repository.

Change-Id: I8ea6c0387b73f8094d306a73dd779967d6d91871
Blueprint: fuel-openstack-tasks

added_lines: import time self.dimension_class = util.Dimensions(agent_config) timer = util.Timer() dimensions = self.dimension_class._set_dimensions({'component': 'monasca-agent', 'service': 'monitoring'}) emit_measurement = metrics.Measurement('monasca.emit_time_sec', time.time(), timer.step(), dimensions) message_batch.extend(emit_measurement)

commit_message:
NetApp: Add Replication support in cDOT

Add support for the replication driver workflows
within the NetApp single-svm cDOT driver.

Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-single-svm-replication
Co-Authored-By: Clinton Knight <cknight@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>

Change-Id: I0a55433f1953facdd5169a2991c67d3f046bcf06

subject: Allow option to disable Swift ring management
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 14:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/83b8bb7bfa420a3f2d03821bf0280f9fb55f1c18', 'message': 'Allow option to disable Swift ring management

There are quite a few cases where it is useful to disable ring building on the
nodes. For example:

- using different weights, regions, and zones
- replacing a node in an existing Swift cluster
- adding a new node to an existing cluster
- using storage policies and therefore multiple rings
- using different nodes and disks for account, container and object servers

This patch allows it to disable ring building. Rings need to be maintained
manually then, and copied to all storage and proxy nodes within a cluster.

This patch is similar to I01311ec3ca265b151f8740bf7dc57cdf0cf0df6f, except that
it uses the current templates.

Change-Id: I56978b15823dd6eaf4b6fd3440df2f895e89611a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow option to disable Swift ring management

There are quite a few cases where it is useful to disable ring building on the
nodes. For example:

- using different weights, regions, and zones
- replacing a node in an existing Swift cluster
- adding a new node to an existing cluster
- using storage policies and therefore multiple rings
- using different nodes and disks for account, container and object servers

This patch allows it to disable ring building. Rings need to be maintained
manually then, and copied to all storage and proxy nodes within a cluster.

This patch is similar to I01311ec3ca265b151f8740bf7dc57cdf0cf0df6f, except that
it uses the current templates.

Change-Id: I56978b15823dd6eaf4b6fd3440df2f895e89611a

commit_message:
Introduce new tasks API `/api/transactions`

This API allow to manipulate all tasks including soft deleted.
It will use for Fuel CLI both versions.
Using this API fuel client can really remove task from DB.
This API should replace '/api/tasks' in future.

Change-Id: I7938929c64de80c3ea0463b15bba7de0f57d9ed1
Implements: blueprint store-deployment-tasks-history

commit_message:
Create a hook in base object to modify the fields before DB operations

Added modify_fields_to_db(), modify_fields_from_db() methods and
fields_need_translation dict to define the map what name in object
implementation should be changed to database naming.
It will prepare dicts before writing to DB and also modify the DB output
to match the OVO layout.

Partial-Bug: #1541928
Change-Id: I923b58870584c5e5756b307760f9d502c53c18b1

commit_message:
Note fullstack depends on released neutronclient

Note in TESTING.rst that fullstack tests that depend on changes to
python-neutronclient to execute need to wait until there is a released
version of python-neutronclient before they will work in the gate.

Change-Id: I1d32c65f0c941cf8f163a441258faa34b50ff88f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/81/297181/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Please note that if the change you would like to test using fullstack tests involves a change to python-neutronclient, then you will need to wait for the next release of python-neutronclient before your fullstack tests will work in the gate. This is because tox uses the latest version of python-neutronclient available by pip, so in order for your fullstack tests to work your python-neutronclient code needs to be available in a released version.

commit_message:
Add unit tests for MServiceManager.list() method

The MServiceManager.list() has already supported the pagination
and sorting features, but there is no unit case to cover
them. This patch tries to add some tests for them.

Change-Id: Ia3877ecbf8c066553a3d5e8cb7cb17753471a1bf
Partial-Bug: #1559838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/28/295128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fake_responses_pagination = { '/v1/mservices/?limit=2': { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE1, SERVICE2]}, ), }, '/v1/mservices/?marker=%s' % SERVICE2['id']: { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE1, SERVICE2]}, ), }, '/v1/mservices/?limit=2&marker=%s' % SERVICE2['id']: { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE2, SERVICE1]}, ), }, } fake_responses_sorting = { '/v1/mservices/?sort_dir=asc': { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE1, SERVICE2]}, ), }, '/v1/mservices/?sort_key=id': { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE1, SERVICE2]}, ), }, '/v1/mservices/?sort_key=id&sort_dir=desc': { 'GET': ( {}, {'mservices': [SERVICE2, SERVICE1]}, ), }, } mservices_listed = self.mgr.list() self.assertThat(mservices_listed, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_limit(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_pagination) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_listed = self.mgr.list(limit=2) expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?limit=2', {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_listed, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_marker(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_pagination) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_listed = self.mgr.list(marker=SERVICE2['id']) expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?marker=%s' % SERVICE2['id'], {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_listed, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_marker_limit(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_pagination) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_listed = self.mgr.list(marker=SERVICE2['id'], limit=2) expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?limit=2&marker=%s' % SERVICE2['id'], {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_listed, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_sort_dir(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_sorting) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_sorted = self.mgr.list(sort_dir='asc') expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?sort_dir=asc', {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_sorted, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_sort_key(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_sorting) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_sorted = self.mgr.list(sort_key='id') expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?sort_key=id', {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_sorted, matchers.HasLength(2)) def test_coe_service_list_with_sort_key_dir(self): self.api = utils.FakeAPI(fake_responses_sorting) self.mgr = mservices.MServiceManager(self.api) mservices_sorted = self.mgr.list(sort_key='id', sort_dir='desc') expect = [ ('GET', '/v1/mservices/?sort_key=id&sort_dir=desc', {}, None), ] self.assertEqual(expect, self.api.calls) self.assertThat(mservices_sorted, Build docs using tox

This commit helps to build the docs using tox, tox -edocs
It would be useful to check for any errors if any docs are
changed.

subject: Restructure Stackviz docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 21:40:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/stackviz/commit/d13e3a8ea9a76daa83f7452c2091b0c5c27369f4', 'message': 'Restructure Stackviz docs

This patch changes the format of Stackviz docs so that all information
is stored in the appropriate doc/source/ directory rather than all
in README.rst. README.rst now just uses the RST include directive to
get its text from doc/source/readme.rst. Usage and installation are
now in their own RST files for increase modularity, and are included
in doc/source/readme.rst.

commit_message:
Restructure Stackviz docs

This patch changes the format of Stackviz docs so that all information
is stored in the appropriate doc/source/ directory rather than all
in README.rst. README.rst now just uses the RST include directive to
get its text from doc/source/readme.rst. Usage and installation are
now in their own RST files for increased modularity, and are included
in doc/source/readme.rst.

Additional developer documentation has also been created at
doc/source/man/ and includes more information on stackviz-export
as well as the AngularJS front-end.

Change-Id: I1d37194add998cf83a66d380ec7390e31184bdb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz refs/changes/51/291451/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Installation - Frontend ----------------------- Installation of the frontend requires Node.js and Gulp. On Ubuntu:: sudo apt-get install nodejs npm nodejs-legacy sudo npm install -g gulp Then, install the Node modules by running, from the project directory:: npm install Installation - Processing ------------------------- The data processor is a small Python module located in the same source tree. To install, run:: sudo pip install .
deleted_lines: ============At the command line:: $ pip install stackviz Or, if you have virtualenvwrapper installed:: $ mkvirtualenv stackviz $ pip install stackviz

commit_message:
Add unit tests for ContainerManager.list() method

The ContainerManager.list() has already supported the pagination
and sorting features, but there is no unit case to cover
them. This patch tries to add some tests for them.

Change-Id: I8fb6767b64848e1f829aaeffc0f44a4bc3e4966d
Partial-Bug: #1559838

commit_message:
Add systemctl reload haproxy to the pacemaker_resource_restart.sh

As discussed in the related bug below, after upgrading your
environment to latest liberty the haproxy config isn't picked
up. This adds a systemctl reload haproxy in the pacemaker
resource restart we run as part of the post-puppet-pacemaker.

Related-Bug: 1561012
Change-Id: Iae3bad745ecdf952a7a0314fe1375d07eb47c454
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/296491/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(marios): remove me once +bug/1561012 systemctl reload haproxy elif [ "$pacemaker_status" = "active" ]; then # TODO(marios): remove this once +bug/1561012 # need this on all controllers: systemctl reload haproxy

image schema, but the metadata schema are needed as well.

help text can't be rendered when there schema is not available in
the system.

commit_message:
Ship the default metadata schema in the client

Now the help message of namespace and resource_type are wrong,
we could see a <unavailable> error when try to get the help
information, such as "glance help md-namespace-create".

See the patch[1] to get more information. the patch[1] added
image schema, but the metadata schema are needed as well.

This patch adds the current metadata schema into client, so that
help text can't be rendered when there schema is not available in
the system.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209536/3

Change-Id: I2ab94d8768114a7e5c475310ba094af653627658
Closes-Bug: #1536430

commit_message:
Fix satellite registration for http or https

If the satellite registration url was specified with https, the curl
command to detect the satellite version would not work as expected since
-L was not passed and you get redirected to https when testing the ping
api.

To additionally handle the case where https is specified, also use curl
directly with -k to download the configuration rpm instead of using rpm
with a url.

Fixes another bug with a missing $ in the reference to the
$satellite_version variable.

Change-Id: I984fdfc415eeeed4ef29cc8d0812e1b67545d6b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/71/296071/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if curl -L -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $ping_api | grep "200 OK"; then elif curl -L -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $REG_SAT_URL/rhn/Login.do | grep "200 OK"; then curl -L -k -O "$REG_SAT_URL/pub/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm" rpm -Uvh katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm || true
deleted_lines: if curl -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $ping_api | grep "200 OK"; then elif curl -k -s -D - -o /dev/null $REG_SAT_URL/rhn/Login.do | grep "200 OK"; then rpm -Uvh "$REG_SAT_URL/pub/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm" || true

commit_message:
Add default value to wait parameter

Adding the wait param without a default broke the api for things calling
it the old way.

Change-Id: I75bbec19f06a0f85bc9cb1fbe4d4c6560dadba49

the _independent project list

commit_message:
Ensure upgrade for sqlalchemy is protected by a lock

Make sure that upgrade() is thread-safe (as it appears not
to be) by using a lock that all connections from the same
engine will use.

Change-Id: I2b2b1be9e797099c8412fc6819465e550b1b934a
Closes-Bug: #1559496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/53/295053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threading self._upgrade_lock = threading.Lock() conn = Connection(self, upgrade_lock=self._upgrade_lock) def __init__(self, backend, upgrade_lock): self._upgrade_lock = upgrade_lock with self._upgrade_lock: with contextlib.closing(self._engine.connect()) as conn: # NOTE(imelnikov): Alembic does not support SQLite, # and we don't recommend to use SQLite in production # deployments, so migrations are rarely needed # for SQLite. So we don't bother about working around # SQLite limitations, and create the database directly # from the tables when it is in use... if 'sqlite' in self._engine.url.drivername: self._metadata.create_all(bind=conn) else: migration.db_sync(conn)
deleted_lines: conn = Connection(self) def __init__(self, backend): with contextlib.closing(self._engine.connect()) as conn: # NOTE(imelnikov): Alembic does not support SQLite, # and we don't recommend to use SQLite in production # deployments, so migrations are rarely needed # for SQLite. So we don't bother about working around # SQLite limitations, and create the database directly from # the tables when it is in use... if 'sqlite' in self._engine.url.drivername: self._metadata.create_all(bind=conn) else: migration.db_sync(conn)

subject: Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 04:17:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/80f63e0f684bf63c43a98c6b7d7ae4e67913664f', 'message': "Catch DB error after HA router race conditions

Neutron server deleted the resources of a HA router,
but l3 agent can not aware it, race happened in this
procedure:
1. neutron server delete all res of a HA router
2. RPC to l3 agent 1 which was HA router master
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to
masert and notify server a HA router state change notify.
4. DB error rasied in updating HA router status

Why 2. and 3. happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets the deleting RPC later
than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove a HA router's keepalived
process will soonly be detected by backup router in l3 agent 2.
Now the router deleting RPC is in the queue of Router Update or any
step of a HA router deleting process. So l3 agent 2 will do the
state change procedure, AKA notify the neutron server to update
router state.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1523780
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-11 07:11:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e8199892d91878d0e362b1b221d03247c328f1c9', 'message': "Catch DB error after HA router race conditions

When neutron server deleted all the resources of
a HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. neutron server delete all res of a HA router
2. RPC to l3 agent 1 in which the HA router was master state
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to
masert and notify server a HA router state change notify.
4. DB error rasied in updating HA router states function

Why the step 2. and 3. happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets the deleting RPC later
than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's keepalived
process will soonly be detected by backup router in l3 agent 2
via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in the queue
of Router Update or any step of a HA router deleting process,
and the router_info will still have 'THE' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race in neutron-server
side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1523780

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a

happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780

happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780

the neutron server to update router state.

commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780

commit_message:
Fix doc generation warnings and errors

When docs are generated with pbr command 'warnerrors = True'
there are many doc problems that are shown. This patch fixes
these problems.

Closes-Bug: #1557234
Change-Id: I05f2f96a582e44be28ab73e0bb80294facf902d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/63/292663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 16:30:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/e6da1aa2743b5da1b36e5082cad7a0763ffa3459', 'message': 'Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm

Ceilometer Alarm is deprecated in Liberty by Aodh.

This patch:
* manage Aodh Keystone resources
* deploy Aodh API under WSGI, Notifier, Listener and Evaluator
* manage new parameters to customize Aodh deployment
* uses ceilometer DB for the upgrade path
* pacemaker config

commit_message:
Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm

Ceilometer Alarm is deprecated in Liberty by Aodh.

This patch:
* manage Aodh Keystone resources
* deploy Aodh API under WSGI, Notifier, Listener and Evaluator
* manage new parameters to customize Aodh deployment
* uses ceilometer DB for the upgrade path
* pacemaker config
* Add migration logic to remove pcs resources

Depends-On: I5333faa72e52d2aa2a622ac2d4b60825aadc52b5
Depends-On: Ib6c9c4c35da3fb55e0ca8e2d5a58ebaf4204d792

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib47a22884afb032ebc1655e1a4a06bfe70249134

commit_message:
Ignore freezer backups

Ignore freezer backups in metrics.

Fixes problem with disk usage alarms flapping
 for /var/freezer directory which may or may not
 exist.

Change-Id: I562bdd71f43e9ca14735954727e4e8837d3b8e92

commit_message:
Implement zone export

Zone export commands (create, list, show, delete, showfile)
are missing from the python-designateclient.

This change includes implementation, as well as unit tests
and functionaltests.

Change-Id: I957946d739bceea1074e2fda2ce7f841143b0611
Partial-Bug: #1550532
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-designateclient refs/changes/94/296094/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ZoneExportsController(V2Controller): def create(self, zone): zone_id = v2_utils.resolve_by_name(self.list, zone) return self._post('/zones/%s/tasks/export' % zone_id) def get_export_record(self, zone_export_id): return self._get('/zones/tasks/exports/%s' % zone_export_id) def list(self): return self._get('/zones/tasks/exports') def delete(self, zone_export_id): return self._delete('/zones/tasks/exports/%s' % zone_export_id) def get_export(self, zone_export_id): return self._get('/zones/tasks/exports/%s/export' % zone_export_id, headers={'Accept': 'text/dns'}) class ZoneImportsController(V2Controller): pass
